Commentary: Bhuvneshwar to Binny, 1 run, dropped! Naman Ojha, with the gloves on, puts one down. The ball went high up and was swirling awkwardly all the way through. But at this level, it should be taken. Binny was completely duped by the slower leg-cutter. Such good bowling from Bhuvi to keep it wide of off and out of reach

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, 1 run, oh Aravind. You really do not grant a life. Certainly not to this guy. Another compulsive pull here from Yuvraj but with the ball gaining in height, only manages the top-edge. Right into the hands of fine leg, who slides and makes an absolute mess

Chahal to Yuvraj, 1 run, is that a bird? Is that a plane? Oh it is Mandeep Singh on his flying ways. Yuvraj goes through with yet another ones of his delightful airy drives. Is in the process of admiration just as Mandy runs across at the long-off fence, leaps and pulls it back into the field of play. Almost plucked it out while landing down too. Oof

Chahal to Henriques, 1 run, a direct hit at the bowler's end and Henriques was struggling. He was coming back for the second run, Dhawan didn't respond one bit. Aravind was the man with the throw and he sent it to the keeper. Kedar Jadhav still had time to effect the run-out, but his shy is way off-target. Henriques scrambles home with a dive. Coming to the ball, it was flat and wide of off, punched to the left of long-off

Dinda to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, dropped by Bhatia. A straightforward chance. Parthiv Patel doesn't get control of the cut and he slices it straight to third man, Bhatia didn't even need to move an inch. It was going arrow straight towards his chest. Straight in and straight out. Oops!

Stokes to Rayudu, 1 run, direct hit and Rayudu was gone! Smith was the fielder, curses himself after he missed the target. A casual knock down the wicket from Rayudu, goes straight to mid-off, Smithy had ample time to target all three at the non-striker's end. A big miss

McClenaghan to Smith, 1 run, dropped! It's Nitish Rana in the deep. The ball flew towards his left and he was on the move but he got there with both hands. Exquisite timing on the short-arm pull from Smith. It's precisely that which gets him in trouble. Rana provides the reprieve. The ball actually hit him flush on the shoulders. That's quite an error. Huge moment

Bumrah to Dhoni, 1 run, dropped! An absolute sitter put down by Southee. Oh boy. They've already dropped Smith earlier. That hasn't quite gone well. Now another one. Dhoni miscues the full toss to deep mid-wicket where Southee doesn't have to move. Dear me

Chawla to Raina, 1 run, fifty for Raina. 29th in IPL. Not one of his best. Quicker delivery on the stumps, clocked at 113kph, that's the pace of Bhatia. Raina is hurried into the flick and sends it along the ground to deep mid-wicket

Chawla to Raina, 1 run, dropped! Would you believe it? I have lost count of the number of chances Raina has got today. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Raina kneels down and sweeps to deep backward square, went straight to Yusuf and he split it. He was on the move a bit and that put him off. He's been whisked away from that position by a stoic GG
Boult to Raina, 1 run, Raina backs away and Boult follows him with a yorker, squeezed to backward point

Woakes to Raina, 1 run, Raina and Woakes collide. Short and slow outside off, Raina cuts it on the bounce to backward point. Both were ball watching and Raina dashed into the bowler, Woakes is down on the ground and Raina makes his crease. The GL skipper goes back to check on Woakes and the Englishman is fine
Shadab Jakati to Gambhir, 1 run, advances and compiles a well-deserved fifty with a ease to long-on
P Kumar to Gambhir, 1 run, bowls it short from round the wicket, Gambhir pulls it away to deep square leg. 150 of the partnership comes up
Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slower length ball outside off, Lynn drills it through cover and brings up a sparkling fifty

Stokes to Saha, 1 run, a very tough chance goes down! Saha prods forward and drills the cover drive. Dan Christian, at cover leaps to his right and gets a hand to it. Those are the ones that need to stick. Wasn't the case this time
Mohit Sharma to Stokes, 1 run, clears his front leg and shovels it down the ground. The yorkers keeping him quiet(er). Nevertheless, the half-ton comes up

Mohit Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, DROPPED!! The man at cover - Vohra had enough time to settle down under it by going back but he makes a meal of it. That was a nothing shot to a length ball and the ball scooped high up in the air and never scaled any distance. Vohra was put off by Natarajan at mid-off who was just beside him. The former could see the fast bowler from the corner of his eye and that was enough

Tymal Mills to Pant, 1 run, beautiful slower ball, it's all the more effective with Mills bowling it. Pant is deceived by the lack of pace and he has to reach out as a result. He skews it right off the toe-end to mid-on. It's fifty for Pant. Superb knock, but he has to go all the way

Nehra to D Kulkarni, 1 run, wristed into the on-side, takes off for a quick single before being sent back. Rashid fires at the bowler's end and misses. The duo run on the overthrow. Karthik was in trouble had that hit

Cutting to P Kumar, 1 run, silly running from the GL batsmen. Could've lost another one. A short of length delivery outside off, Kumar toe-ends the drive to extra cover, takes off for a single. The fielder collects the ball and fires a throw but misses the target. PK had given up

Nehra to D Kulkarni, 1 run, wristed into the on-side, takes off for a quick single before being sent back. Rashid fires at the bowler's end and misses. The duo run on the overthrow. Karthik was in trouble had that hit

Cutting to P Kumar, 1 run, silly running from the GL batsmen. Could've lost another one. A short of length delivery outside off, Kumar toe-ends the drive to extra cover, takes off for a single. The fielder collects the ball and fires a throw but misses the target. PK had given up

Bumrah to M Pandey, 1 run, here's his half-ton. Playing a vital hand here. Gets there with a flat batted agricultural heave. Then watches all his effort neutralized by the ball finding deep mid-wicket on the bounce

Woakes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, Woakes botches a run-out opportunity! He just had to collect the ball cleanly. Rana was well short. Rana couldn't find any elevation as he tried to flat-bat the back of length delivery and he hit it straight to mid-off. Never a run there, but the non-striker had come a long way down so Rana obliged. Would have been gone

Woakes to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, direct hit and Parthiv was running back. Finally he connects with one of his heaves, not middled though and finds Yusuf at mid-wicket. The shy is at the bowler's end and it is way off target

Watson to Maxwell, 1 run, dropped by backward point, a real sitter, RCB fans can't believe it! Full and wide, Maxi slices the drive sitting deep inside his crease, it went flat and straight to Mandeep Singh. He was a tad slow to react, straight in and straight out
Stanlake to Vohra, 1 run, goes wide of the crease and angles one on the pads, clipped away sweetly to deep square leg. 50-up for Punjab

Stokes to Samson, 1 run, just short of the long-on fielder and Samson reaches his fifty! Pitched up delivery, Samson lofted it over mid-on and falls in front of the diving long-on fielder. Samson collects a single to get to his milestone
Hardik Pandya to Warner, leg byes, 1 run, short of a good length and on Warner's hips, he was looking to nudge and missed, rolled away off his pads towards square leg

Axar to Gambhir, 1 run, 33rd IPL fifty for GG. Equals Warner's record for the most number of fifties. Waves his bat around to acknowledge the Eden Garden crowd. Reaches the milestone with a wristy flick through mid-wicket

Boult to Vohra, 1 run, Narine has shelled a sitter at third man. Oh dear. Boult just turns around in despair. A short of length delivery, Vohra tries to pull off the front foot and sends a top-edge flying down to third man. They don't come easier than that
Narine to Amla, 1 run, fires them in, 103kph, Amla punches it to the right of point and quickly goes through to the other end

Woakes to Maxwell, 1 run, dropped by Uthappa! Definitely two noises there. Back of length, cutting in and takes the inside edge. The ball deflects off Maxwell's thigh as well. Uthappa dives to his left with one hand but the ball hits him hard on the glove

Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, 1 run, dropped! Buttler went backwards at deep-midwicket, then circled under it and drops it in the end. That was a mistimed slog-sweep and the ball stayed in the sky for a long long time. Buttler messed it up by never really judging it

Jadeja to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, hammered back at the bowler and that's not really a chance. Props to Jadeja for getting his hands in position quick enough and attempt a catch but he can't hold on. It was hit powerfully. Saved a boundary really
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, flicks to square leg and rushes for a non-existent single. Dhawan aims at the bowler's end and misses, had that hit Uthappa was a goner. He is living dangerously here

Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, catch it is the cry, but Woakes can't hold onto it. That came in at a rapid pace. Once again, Dhawan gives the charge and this time he slashes it off the middle of the bat. The Englishman at cover-point dived to his right and half-stopped it. Saved three runs there

Mohit Sharma to Billings, 1 run, fifty for Billings. Raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from the home crowd. Still a long way to go for him. The pitch has started to get slower and run making is not going to be easy. With him being set, DD would want him to carry on. Coming to the ball: Plays the slower delivery with soft hands into the off-side ring and jogs across to the other end
Cariappa to Billings, 1 run, rushes it through outside off, Billings goes deep in his crease and pats it softly to cover

Corey Anderson to Miller, 1 run, is that a dropped catch? It looks like it. Another very full ball, Miller crashes it to the right of cover where Zaheer goes across low with both hands but fails to hold on
Pat Cummins to Axar, 1 run, dabs a short of length off-cutter straight to short third man. They impetuously run across for a non-existent single. Mohit had given up. No direct hit though

Chris Morris to Miller, 1 run, ah! A direct hit there at the striker's end would have been curtains to Eoin Morgan! Miller taps this length ball to covers with soft hands and sets off. Billings chases it down and fires in a throw quickly. Misses the target just by a few inches

Krunal Pandya to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, fifty for McCullum. A very unlike McCullum innings this. Waves his bat around and is congratulated by his skipper. Looked scratchy to start off and has slowly found his bearings. GL would want him to continue. Flatter and on off, worked to deep square leg

Krunal Pandya to Raina, 1 run, direct hit and McCullum would have been on his bike. Raina punched this towards extra cover, where Suchith got a good bounce and it was to his strong hand as well. Fires a throw at the striker's end and fails to hit the stumps. McCullum was stretching and would have been touch and go

Basil Thampi to Nitish Rana, 1 run, dropped! Jason Roy has put down a dolly. The pacy short ball catches Rana by surprise. He still persists with his pull shot and gets it off the top part of the willow. The ball balloons up on the leg-side. Roy, at mid-wicket, runs back, settles under it and makes a mess of it. Thampi can't believe it. He has to wait for his first IPL wicket
Andrew Tye to Rohit, 1 run, as expected starts with a slower delivery outside off, Rohit drives to sweeper cover

Basil Thampi to Pollard, 1 run, run-out chance and Kishan hits the stump mic instead of the stumps. Pollard was a goner. Thampi nails the wide yorker, Pollard digs it to point and sets off for the single, no response from Rohit and he had to turn back, well short with a direct hit. No one backing up and the duo eventually get the single

SN Thakur to Binny, 1 run, what an effort from Stokes. This is stunning fielding. He's actually caught the ball and has control over it, but he doesn't have control over his weight which is causing him to fall over the ropes. So he has to flick it back in - does so incredibly, through his legs. Lots of height from Binny on the slog, fair amount of distance too. Stokes's foot is stationed just a foot inside the ropes at wide long-on, he takes it overhead, and flicks it in. They just take a single
Unadkat to Milne, 1 run, slower back of a length delivery on middle, Milne glances it to short fine leg. Badree was struggling had Thakur hit direct

Coulter-Nile to Chris Morris, 1 run, dropped! Tough chance, but when you get two hands, you have to catch it. Short delivery and Morris is hurried into the pull, spliced towards long-on. Umesh runs forward and across, overruns and the ball comes near his waist while he was diving forward, hits his hands and pops out. GG is not happy with the effort

Coulter-Nile to Chris Morris, 1 run, Morris living a charmed life. Now, GG puts one down. What do you say now skipper? Umesh might be asking. It was a straightforward chance unlike his. Slower delivery and Morris is early into the drive, toe-ends it towards extra cover. It was going in slow motion and GG lost it in the background. The ball hit his fingers and went to ground
Pat Cummins to M Pandey, 1 run, a fore-handed stroke to send this short ball to long-on. Manish Pandey notches up his fifty with that single
Mishra to M Pandey, 1 run, flays this flatter ball through cover. 50-stand up

Bhuvneshwar to Vohra, 1 run, put down, put down! Dhawan seemed to have grabbed that for a split second, but no, it's down. Back of a length outside off, Vohra carves it off the back foot but he's hit it very close to sweeper cover. The ball was travelling though and Dhawan can't hang onto it as he was on the move

Basil Thampi to Gayle, 1 run, 10,000 runs in T20 cricket for Gayle! Full, pacy delivery outside off, Gayle throws his horizontal blade at it and the ball runs down to third man off the outside part of the bat
S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, a tame flat-drive through cover to get to his fifty, but that won't help. 4/4 wins for SRH at home, yet again their bowling comes to the rescue. Superb death bowling

Chris Morris to Warner, 1 run, direct hit would have made things interesting. Pitched up delivery outside off, Warner pushes to mid-off and sets off. He puts in a dive. But had Jayant Yadav found the target, Warner would have been a goner

Zaheer to Dhawan, 1 run, fifty for Dhawan. His first of the season. After a couple of 40s, he finally has a half-century to his name. That should bring back the confidence in him. Williamson walks up and congratulates him on the milestone. The knuckle ball which is short in length, Dhawan is early into the pull and lobs it off the edge to fine leg
Malinga to Amla, 1 run, slower and wider, Amla had to fetch, pings a single to cover to celebrate his fifty. Job half-done, his team-mates are a happy bunch in the dugout

Ishant to Buttler, 1 run, 140kph, and sliced away even faster. Keeps it wide making Buttler stretch every cell of his body in getting close. Does with a square stab. Brings up the 50 between the duo as well
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, slid in from round the wicket, Buttler jabs it to the right of long-on and brings up his half-century. Mumbai will hope that this knock gets his season going
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, drives to the right of a diving bowler and marks his fifty
Kuldeep Yadav to Jadeja, 1 run, generously tossed up on off, overpitches, and Jadeja drills it down to long-on

Raina to Uthappa, 1 run, uppish, catchable but Finch lets it slip. A tough chance though. Maybe a swifter fielder would have easily had that. Shortish delivery on the stumps, Uthappa mistimes the pull, Finch didn't move quickly to his right from long-on, tried to grab the ball with his right hand but couldn't
Dwayne Smith to Gambhir, 1 run, steered away to third man

Siraj to Dhoni, 1 run, Tripathi had given up there. But backward point has just one stump to aim at and Vijay Shankar, who is on as a substitute, misses. Even wider than the previous ball and Dhoni has to really reach out for the cut. He mistimes it to the left of the fielder who turns around quickly after collecting and fires it in. Not great judgement from these two batsmen

Siraj to Dhoni, 1 run, just about carries to Bhuvneshwar but he cannot hold on. Pops out of his fingertips. A low full toss which is very wide of off and Dhoni squirts it right off the toe-end as he reaches out
S Kaul to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, good length delivery outside off, Tiwary mistimes the drive to extra-cover
Rashid Khan to Tripathi, 1 run, maiden IPL fifty for Tripathi, pushed through outside off, Tripathi hangs back and works it wide of cover

McClenaghan to Rabada, 1 run, shuffles well across. Almost a set of stumps away and flicks it away to short fine. Again, a shy at the stumps at the non-striker's end..a direct hit would have meant curtains
Zaheer to Nitish Rana, 1 run, subtle change of pace. Rana plays it late as he tucks it to short fine. A good throw from the fielder would have had Rana struggling at the non-striker's end

Andrew Tye to Maxwell, 1 run, confusion but Amla survives. Nathu Singh from short fine leg failed to hit the target at the striker's end. Maxwell got across to flick this one straight to him. He got the ball, the batsmen in the meantime were staring dead into each other's eyes - standing in the middle of the pitch. Eventually decided to go for the run. And as luck would have it. Amla stayed

Stokes to Pollard, 1 run, oh a mix-up. Could have been a lot more. But for these missed aims. A polite knock to mid-wicket from Pollard and he just charges out to get away. Rohit meanwhile stands half way down the pitch hoping his partner would return. None of that happening though. And the Wankhede doesn't let sound travel, even across the pitch. Rohit has to thank a wayward throw
Unadkat to Rohit, 1 run, fifty #30. Gets there with a standing dab wide of point. All so nonchalant

McClenaghan to Tripathi, 1 run, direct hit at the striker's end and Rahane is in. The TV umpire was called for assistance. Easy one for him. Short of a good length delivery wide of off, Tripathi taps it towards backward point and responds to a quick call from Rahane. Pollard finds the target, but Rahane was easily home
Christian to Uthappa, 1 run, a dazzling fifty for Robbie! That was short and he was quick to swat the pull away for a single. Soaks in the applause as the KKR camp is happy and so is the skipper

Christian to Gambhir, 1 run, slower short ball, the ball climbs onto the batsman. Gambhir gets a top-edge and the man running in from the short fine leg region - Sundar drops it. The ball popped out as his elbows thudded onto the ground. Another dropped chance, another charmed life

U Yadav to Smith, 1 run, fifty for Smith. This was a long time coming. He got a few starts in the previous games but hadn't converted them. This time he does. Another wide yorker and Smith squeezes it to backward point

de Grandhomme to Tripathi, 1 run, Yusuf has made a mess of a simple chance, ran back from mid-wicket, got to the ball, went with both hands and shells it. Looks bad on replays. Coming to the ball, it was short and just outside off, Tripathi swung across the line, got a fat top-edge - high and towards mid-on

Faulkner to Aravind, 1 run, they are running for everything. The back of the hand delivery and Aravind is early into the drive, the inside edge rolls to the right of Karthik, he shies and misses. Choudhary survives
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fifty of the combo comes up! That was on the pads and clipped away uppishly for the man at deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Corey Anderson, 1 run, shot back like a bullet by Corey Anderson and the bowler spills another one. This was a tough one and almost burst through the hands of the bowler. It was a flighted ball and the batsman found it in his radar and slapped it back with ferocity for it to be fluffed
Mishra to Gambhir, 1 run, pushes a single down to long-off

Corey Anderson to Uthappa, 1 run, fifty for Uthappa. It is his fourth this season. Waves the bat around, walks towards his skipper and shakes hands. Got it in 26 balls against RPS, today has taken two balls less. Back of a length and on the hips, tucked square on the leg-side
S Kaul to Saha, 1 run, dabs the ball to point and allowed Yuvraj, standing at point to have a shy at the batting end. A direct hit and Shaun Marsh would have been miles short of his ground

Axar to Williamson, 1 run, gently knocks a flatter delivery to the right of Axar and runs for a risky single. Axar slides and aims, misses by a whisker, had that hit Williamson would have been in trouble
Maxwell to Warner, 1 run, fifty for Warner. Gets there with a risky single. Hits it straight to point and set off. Anureet Singh fumbles and allows the duo a single
Maxwell to Dhawan, 1 run, fifty for Dhawan now. Taps it to square leg and gets to the milestone. Raises his bat to the crowd and soaks in the applause
Binny to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, the 50-partnership up. Opens the bat face and guides a single down to third man
McClenaghan to Basil Thampi, 1 run, Rana puts down a dolly. Full toss dished wide of off, Thampi slices the drive and chips straight to cover-point. Straight in and straight out

Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run, DROPPED! Thampi at mid-wicket has tipped it over the bar! That was full on the pads and clipped by Pollard and uppishly but it went straight to Thampi, who made a meal of it. Mumbai having some nervy moments here

Faulkner to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, Raina, Oh Raina! Almost plucks out a blinder out of thin air. That was hoicked away on the on-side and the man at mid-wicket leaped up with his right hand flicking the ball over him. That was a very tough chance
Ankit Soni to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, a nudge towards backward square leg for a single with which Parthiv Patel brings up his fifty! Just a raise of bat
Shami to Guptill, 1 run, full and on the stumps, Guptill makes room and drills it hard towards mid-on. 50-up for Punjab in no time

Nadeem to Guptill, 1 run, game, set and match - Punjab. What a way to finish the game. Guptill lowers his center of gravity and sweeps it through square leg. He raises his fifty as well. Punjab win by 10 wickets

Coulter-Nile to Yuvraj, 1 run, dropped, easy chance. NCN almost killed the fielder with that stare. Sheldon Jackson it was. Shortish and on the leg stump, Yuvraj flicks in a whippy manner, Jackson ran to his left slightly and covered the distance nicely, looked like he'd easily catch it but it popped out

Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, 1 run, yes-no, but all is well in the end. The wrong' un from Kuldeep, Warner defends towards backward point and sets off, slight hesitation, but Dhawan was rushing towards the striker's end, the throw should have gone to the bowler

Aravind to Rohit, 1 run, fifty for Rohit. He tries to cut this into the off-side, chops it towards backward point. Been an excellent innings. Absorbed the pressure, didn't take too many risks and has almost taken his side home

Krunal Pandya to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, nudged to short fine leg, Kedar Jadhav is ambling along. Taking it easy. Had Bumrah hit direct, he would've been walking back. Not a wise decision that, and especially when your captain is Kohli. Very poor from Kedar Jadhav

McClenaghan to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, Rohit leaves it to Buttler coming in from sweeper when it was his catch. The ball lands bang in the middle of the two. McClenaghan bowling it wide as he saw Kedar Jadhav advancing, in the end - it was a one-handed slice in the air and the batsman got lucky

Christian to Finch, 1 run, Stokes misses a direct hit here. Certain run out opportunity. Firstly, Finch is duped by a slower ball. Pops it up towards short point, where Stokes comes sprinting in and attacks the ball. Picks the right end too, with Finch having given up, but misses
Dwayne Smith to Stokes, 1 run, 50 for Stokes. Second one in the IPL. Pune need him tonight. Pulls a short ball to deep mid-wicket to get to the milestone

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Henriques over-trusts his legs and spoils a catch that could have been 'the one' for Dhawan who ran from sweeper towards this skier. Shreyas Iyer had thrown his bat at a wide ball and sliced off the outer half. If not for his luck and Henriques ambitions, Shreyas Iyer would have been walking back

Siraj to Nair, 1 run, dropped! Bhuvi, the culprit. Nair, trying to be too cheeky, almost gifted his wicket. Moves across a long way and attempted the scoop shot. Got decent amount of wood, but there wasn't enough elevation there. It went at catchable height to Bhuvi at short fine. He makes a mess of it

Tahir to M Pandey, 1 run, guides with the turn to short third man and calls for the run. Pathan has to hurry as Dhoni does that blind trick to hit the stumps at the striker's end. Yeah, that thing where he flicks the ball back on to the stumps even as he keeps his eyes on the thrower
Faulkner to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, now he manages a leg bye this this. Early into his swat, Pant deflects it off his pads.. and runs
Ankit Soni to Samson, 1 run, hunches forward and sweetly drives it to long-off. 50-stand up between the two
Corey Anderson to Karthik, 1 run, uses his wrists and directs this short of length delivery on the pads through mid-wicket for a single which brings up his 14th IPL fifty!

Rabada to Raina, 1 run, it's dropped this time. Gee, this is a crazy over. Two wickets, one just escaped the fielder and then one was put down. This time Rabada does what most fast bowlers with pace do to Raina. Bowl that bouncer and have him jumping around in the crease. It was down the leg-side, Raina could back away or duck, tried to pull, the ball went off the back of the bat, a lob it was to first slip. Easiest of chances, but Shreyas Iyer spills it. Rabada is very disappointed

S Kaul to Smith, 1 run, put down. Oh Bipul Sharma. Neutralizes all the work he did with Tripathi's dismissal with a horrific piece of catching. At the same position - short fine. Smith fetches it off his pads and fails to keep the glance down finding the man at 45 behind square to perfection. Gets both hands to it over his eyeline and watches it fluff out

Henriques to Smith, 1 run, another life. At short fine leg again. This time it is Bhuvi Kumar playing godfather. Smith seems keen on his walking flicks, once again doesn't keep it down and gives Bhuvi a chance with a dive to his left. In the palms and popping out

Tahir to Yuvraj, 1 run, was that a chance? Yes, it was - a tough chance but you need to grab those when you are defending a low score. This was dropped short by Tahir, Yuvraj swivelled across on the pull, didn't bothered to keep it down. It was travelling and to his left, Sundar went with both hands, got to the ball but can't hold on. On the second viewing, it was closer to him, should take those at this level
Mishra to Simmons, 1 run, tossed up outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single, brings up another IPL fifty
Negi to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slow on off, Lynn pats it with the turn into the off-side to bring up his half-century. It's come off 21 balls, at a snail's pace
de Grandhomme to Head, 1 run, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Head was early into the drive once again - ends up dragging it down towards long-on for a single
Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, pokes the ball into the off-side to bring up the 50-run opening stand

Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, 1 run. David Miller drops a dolly. It hung in the air for an eternity, Smith cursed himself and almost started walking to the pavilion, but luck seemed to have smiled on him. Smith looks to go straight with a loft, doesn't locate the middle. It goes up in the air towards mid-off, Miller comes in sets himself and looks to take it reverse cupped, it just doesn't stick. Hits him on the side of the palm and drops to the ground

Maxwell to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, Dwayne Smith drank elixir today! Gets another life. Short ball and he pulls it to long-on, who dives forward but fails to get underneath the ball. Got hands to it so will go down as a chance

Ankit Soni to Amla, 1 run, fifty for Hash. The century stand is raised as well. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Amla mistimes the lofted on-drive to long-on. This has been a fine innings from the South African batsman. It's been a good mix of aggressive hits with gentle nudges
D Kulkarni to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, slower delivery outside off stump, Marsh pushes it towards point and raises his bat for a fifty. Another sensible innings from the Aussie

Basil Thampi to Amla, 1 run, dropped. Jaddu it is! Went to his right - not his natural side. Got both hands to it and he's livid with himself for putting it down. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Amla punches it uppishly, hit very well, backward point flew to his right, there was a dive but the ball popped out
Henriques to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, wide of off again from Henriques, Pandya scythes it in front of square on the off-side. The single brings up the 50-run stand

Siraj to Rohit, 1 run, fifty for Rohit Sharma! A captain's knock. Pushes a fuller length delivery down the ground, that evades the fingers of the bowler. The ball hits the stumps and deflects towards long-on

Malinga to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, celebrates his selection into the Indian squad with a half-ton. And he's taking his team home. Gets a nothing delivery on the pads and puts it away with a glance to fine leg

Malinga to Dhawan, 1 run, keeps up with his leg-liners. This time darting it a lot fuller. Flicked away in front of square. Okay, this is his half-ton. ctrl C + ctrl V the description from a few balls earlier
Rahul Tewatia to Chris Lynn, 1 run, tossed up ball around off, Chris Lynn drives to deep extra cover to bring up his third IPL fifty
Narine to Saha, 1 run, the off-break. A room creating punch down to long-off. Brings up the 50-run between the duo

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, another risky run. The running between the wickets hasn't been good all through this innings. Iyer taps a length ball straight to cover and calls his partner through for a quick single. Kishan fires in an underarm throw and misses the target at the striker's end. A direct hit would have been curtains for Corey Anderson

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, leg byes, 2 runs, a direct hit and Iyer would have been a goner. Very full pacy delivery down leg, Iyer misses the flick, strikes his pad and runs towards fine leg. The throw is decent at the striker's end, but there is no one near the stumps. Iyer gets a couple. Raina is animated as he wanted the bowler to be at the stumps. Had Thampi been there, would've had the chance to run Iyer out. Thampi was just standing and watching - poor!

Sangwan to Nair, 1 run, poor running once again. There's never a run there but both batsmen just decide to go through on instinct and never take a chance to process their decision. Nair steers this back of length ball with impeccable timing but Raina's dive at backward point parries it to the fielder beside him. A direct-hit would have consumed Nair
Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fired in fuller, Iyer prods it away into the point region
Mohit Sharma to Pollard, 1 run, Mohit seals the deal for his team. Punjab win by 7 runs. Again, fires it in the blockhole, Pollard just about gets his bat down and digs it out

Sandeep Sharma to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, has switched to the yorkers. Bang on the sticks. A dance away and down in the same motion to half-drill, half-squeeze it down to mid-off. A direct hit and you never know. Because there isn't one

Axar to Simmons, 1 run, the time-out almost brings a wicket with it. Smashed down, doesn't bother keeping it down and pops in and out the man at long-off lined up. Ah the dew. And the drop. Mohit Sharma the man
Washington Sundar to Nair, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, nudged away behind square on the on-side, raises his 8th IPL fifty, his first this season

Samuels to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, that could have been a sensational catch, but Samson cannot cling on! Samuels begins with a half-tracker which should have been deposited in the stands, but Tiwary doesn't go through with the pull. He checks his shot, might have stopped on him. It travels low and quick in front of Samson at deep mid-wicket. He runs in full throttle, dives forward nearly plucks it off

Zaheer to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, dropped by Nair! Oh dear. This, right here, could be game defining, considering how this partnership is starting to flourish. Tiwary wants to take on a cutter from Zaheer, but the wily old veteran has angled it so wide that Tiwary has to really reach out. The cut on the ball catches a thick top-edge and lobs up to the right of point. Nair never really looked settled under the ball, was still on the move as it came down and makes a mess of it

Zaheer to Smith, 1 run, we will have to wait to ascertain what happened there? Shreyas Iyer has done a commendable job to save a six. Could not control the momentum and threw the ball away, else he could have come back to catch that one - like Stokes did earlier in the day. Short ball and Smith pulls off the back foot. Looks good to clear the fence but Iyer runs to his right from deep square leg, leaps and parries it back into play
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, 50 for Dwayne Smith now. Cracked through cover
Nabi to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, fired in on the stumps, Dwayne Smith drives and gets a single to long-on
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, 50 for Dwayne Smith now. Cracked through cover
Nabi to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, fired in on the stumps, Dwayne Smith drives and gets a single to long-on

Southee to M Pandey, 1 run, dropped by Suchith! The sub on for someone. A flat pull from Pandey and the sub running forward at deep mid-wicket can't cling on. That could be the game then and there. Wasn't a difficult take too
U Yadav to Rayudu, 1 run, keeps walking and nurdles it away off the hips down to fine leg

Unadkat to Saha, 1 run, edged and dropped, MS is the culprit, went late for the catch, got his fingertips and the ball pops out. This was full and wide of off, Saha went for the drive, played away from his body, gets a thick edge that went right in the middle of the keeper and Christian at first slip. He didn't budge, MS went for it as an afterthought and fumbled
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, 1 run, Rahane slogs and is in danger there. Guptill has it covered with a reverse cup at deep mid-wicket. Hold on, he is not having a good day and so, he drops it
Zaheer to Kohli, 1 run, here's the half-ton. Kotla acknowledges. A leaning drive off an opened bat face through sweeper gets him there. The fourth of the season
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, another sweep shot through mid-wicket. The single brings up Rahane's fifty. He should up the ante now
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, FIFTY for the combo! A reverse attempted by Rahane and he manages to locate the man at short third man
Coulter-Nile to Warner, 1 run, once again, no room on offer for Warner. It was a low full toss to Warner who was backing away. Mistimed drill to cover. Brings up the 50-run stand
Coulter-Nile to Warner, 1 run, once again, no room on offer for Warner. It was a low full toss to Warner who was backing away. Mistimed drill to cover. Brings up the 50-run stand

Christian to Johnson, byes, 1 run, looks for the deft upper cut and misses. The ball lands on a couple of bounces to the keeper, who fumbles to allow the single. The man at short third man mopped it up and had a shy at the bowler's end. Had there been a direct hit, it would have been another casualty
Christian to Johnson, 1 run, the partnership between Johnson and Krunal Pandya is now 50!! Short ball, pulled away and the ball lands on the bounce to be picked up by Rahane at deep mid

Christian to Johnson, byes, 1 run, looks for the deft upper cut and misses. The ball lands on a couple of bounces to the keeper, who fumbles to allow the single. The man at short third man mopped it up and had a shy at the bowler's end. Had there been a direct hit, it would have been another casualty
Christian to Johnson, 1 run, the partnership between Johnson and Krunal Pandya is now 50!! Short ball, pulled away and the ball lands on the bounce to be picked up by Rahane at deep mid

Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, 1 run, direct hit would have made things interesting. Another slower ball, the knuckle ball this time. Rayudu gets squared up and defends off the outside part to backward point. The fielder has a shy at the stumps, misses by a long way and Raina is hit on his wrists. A direct hit would have been curtains for the southpaw
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, very full and outside off, drilled down the ground to long-off, 36th IPL fifty for Gambhir! What a way to start the season! He's looked ominous right from the word go today
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, very full and outside off, drilled down the ground to long-off, 36th IPL fifty for Gambhir! What a way to start the season! He's looked ominous right from the word go today

Kulwant Khejroliya to Vinay Kumar, 1 run, dropped! Washington Sundar at deep cover. VK slapped this length ball over cover, Sundar came running in and seemed to have judged well to snaffle the ball under his throat, but just as he rolled over to avoid the tumble, the ball slipped out of his grasp. Unlucky!

Washington Sundar to Narine, 1 run, 50 off 17 balls! Can you believe it? He has done it again. He's making a habit of it. Charges down the wicket and whips the floated delivery to deep mid-wicket. Reaches the milestone and raises the bat, acknowledges the crowd!
Narine to Mandeep, 1 run, fires this carrom ball on a back of length outside off, Mandeep pats it wide of cover. He was struggling on the single there, would have been gone with a direct-hit

S Kaul to Tripathi, 1 run, appeal for LBW and SRH want a review. Kaul was convinced and he forced his captain to go for it. It's a fair delivery, it's pad first, but I reckon that the impact was outside off, at best it could be umpire's call. Hawk-Eye in and the impact is well outside off, NOT OUT is the call. SRH lose their review, on a good length and shaping back in, Tripathi got across his stumps as he defended, the ball clipped the flap oif the bat before deflecting towards mid-off

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, dropped! Tom Curran did a remarkable job of getting to the ball. So, tough to call it a drop. Flighted outside off, Raina sans footwork went for the inside out loft, nowhere near the middle and the ball skied towards deep extra cover. Curran ran forward, dived full length and got fingertips to it

Tom Curran to Billings, 1 run, fifty for Billings. CSK needed someone to take over the baton after Raina's wicket and the Kent batsman has taken the onus on himself to keep the chase going. Raises the bat and gets the applause from the yellow faithfuls. Walked across his stumps and Curran fired it in the blockhole, the sweep comes off the under edge and bobbles away to fine leg

Harbhajan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flat and shortish ball, Lynn stays deep in his crease and pulls it powerfully. He would have thought that a boundary was there for the taking. But, there was Chahar at square leg, who flew full length to his left and could only get a hand on it. It will be too harsh to call that as a drop, he got both hands though, perhaps had a chance to cling on
Rahul Tewatia to Samson, 1 run, tight single but they get it in the end with ease. Slower and outside off, Samson stays back and pats it into the gap at cover. 50-run stand is up!

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, 1 run, chance and Hooda has dropped it. That's a massive let-off for Rohit, no calling at all, Hooda ran back from mid-wicket, it was perhaps Rashid's catch as he came in from deep mid-wicket. Short of a length and on the stumps, Rohit was in no control over the pull, got a fat top-edge that went high and over mid-wicket. Hooda back-pedalled, wasn't in control as he went for the catch, the ball hit his palms and burst out.

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, chance and dropped, Kishan was looking clueless against Rashid, but the bowler has been let-down by his fielder. He didn't spot the wrong 'un as he gave the charge, doesn't get anywhere close to the ball, gets a thick top-edge over cover, Sandeep back pedalled, looked certain to take the catch and then makes a mess of it

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dropped, tough chance though! Fizz the man there at short third man. Slower delivery wide outside off stump, Iyer checks the dab, gets a leading edge that flies to the left of short third, Fizz moved to his left and dived, but couldn't hold on. Massive moment in the game

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, another catch put down and it's Fizz again. You don't deserve to win if you are going to field like that. That stare from Rohit Sharma tells it all. Silence all around the Wankhede. Good length delivery outside off stump, Iyer backs away and slices it, went to the right of short third man, easy catch and he spills it

Shakib to Narine, 1 run, Manish Pandey is on fire in the field tonight, as he almost pulls off yet another stunner. Leaps up in the air near the boundary, takes the catch and parries it away as he's about to hit the ground. Narine walked down the track and lofted that to long-on where Pandey plucked it, parried it and tried to take it on the second attempt with a desperate dive, but hard luck. Could have been six on any other day.

Narine to Williamson, 1 run, another out-swinger on a good length, punched down to long-off. Brings up the fifty for Williamson. He has to finish this off for his team, lest the follow the route they took against Mumbai
Stokes to Kohli, 1 run, 50-run stand up with that single as Kohli drags it away to deep mid-wicket, the crowd thought it was in the gap, but it wasn't
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, 1 run, 31st IPL fifty for Kohli! RCB want him to get a big one tonight, he's not done yet. Was a loopy delivery that was driven down to long-on

Woakes to Samson, 1 run, another excellent yorker, it's been a top over from Woakes thus far. Samson squeezes it out towards point to get to his 8th IPL fifty! Is this the breakthrough season he wanted? Has definitely started that way
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, fullish and outside off stump, Dhoni guides it towards point

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, that was a wide ball but Dhoni chose to have a swing at it, mistimed with one hand to long-off and that's fifty for the captain. No celebrations but he gets a big applause from everyone
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 1 run, oh he's missed a big hit here. Full and outside off stump, better of going over cover but knowing Dhoni, he believes in muscling the ball rather than lofting over cover
Tom Curran to Pant, 1 run, Curran shortens his length outside off, steered to the left of cover-point. Pant waits for the ball to pass the fielder and then jogs across for a single
Boult to Nitish Rana, 1 run, full on off, Nitish Rana looks to flick and the leading edge dribbles to backward point. 50 for Nitish Rana and it's his first one in KKR colors

Washington Sundar to Lewis, 1 run, close shave for Lewis! Didn't put in the dive and trusted his long reach to bail him through. The direct hit at the bowler's end did test him to be frank but the West Indian got through in the end, only just though. It was a nicely floated off break to start with, gripped a touch and forced a leading edge towards backward point. There was a slight stutter in the running before they eventually decided to go ahead with it. No harm done in the end

Corey Anderson to Rohit, 1 run, direct hit would have been close! Lewis was certainly in double but Mandeep's throw at the keeper's end misses by a whisker. Was a goner if it had hit. Wide yorker that was squeezed by Rohit towards backward point
Hardik Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, fifty for VK, but he won't celebrate. Doesn't even raise the bat. Just nudges this length ball into the on-side and gets to the milestone

Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, 1 run, fired it in quick on off, Mandeep pushes it to the right of Rohit at extra cover, who swiftly moves across and releases the throw in one motion. Hits the target but Mandeep's makes it in by dragging his bat
Shivam Mavi to D Kulkarni, 1 run, Lynn at backward point drops a simple catch. Kulkarni sliced it and Lynn drops it. What's more it brings Buttler on strike too

Jordan to Gayle, 1 run, slower and very full on the pads, nudged towards the big spaces at mid-wicket. Jordan has to chase it himself and that allows the single. 23rd IPL fifty for Gayle, second on the trot to start a new season. The Jamaican is making a statement, that's for sure

S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, put your hands together for the universe boss! Christopher Henry Gayle brings up his 6th IPL hundred. Off comes the helmet, raises his bat to soak in the applause from the Mohali crowd and unleashes the 'Baby in the arms' celebration. Reached the landmark with a squeezy drive to point

S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, oh this was nearly a run out! A highish full toss miscued to extra cover, who with a direct hit could have gotten Gayle. Throw is right on cue to Kaul but he's not in a position to under-arm the ball onto the stumps. Chance missed, Gayle makes it back in...
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, 1 run, saw Gayle giving the charge and smartly shortened the length around middle and leg, eased away down to long-on. 50 up for KXIP
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, back to off breaks, is Ashwin. Williamson slaps it to sweeper cover to hoist a fifty

Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, dropped by Mujeeb at deep mid-wicket. Ashwin actually did well by spinning it into Shakib but Shakib's in that mood. Carved across the line, only to be let off. That's the long side of the boundary and that should have been taken

Barinder to Y Pathan, 1 run, what are you doing Yuvi! He drops a sitter. This is as easy as they come. Pathan mistimes the cut shot and he hits it straight to cover point where Yuvi makes a mess of it. Reacted very late as he went reverse-cup style and it popped out

Binny to Watson, 1 run, edged and dropped! Rahul Tripathi the culprit on that occasion. Puts down a sitter. Was a full length delivery outside off, Watson goes for a drive and the away swing induces an outside edge. However, Tripathi - the lone slipper makes a mess out of it

Unadkat to Watson, 1 run, hundred for Watson. Two in two days in this IPL. Gayle yesterday and Watson today. The helmet comes off and the bat is up in the air to acknowledge the applause of the traveling fans. There was also a little fist pump as soon as he placed it in the gap. He scored a hundred for Royals while playing against CSK and now he's done the vice versa - the first player to do that. Coming to the ball: Back of a length around off, Watson knocks it wide of point and reaches the milestone

Unadkat to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, dropped! Samson the man who puts it down. Bravo tried to repeat the previous shot, but does not get the elevation on the cut shot, Samson jumps up at backward point and parries it over him. Should have done a better job there. RR have not had a good day in the field

Gowtham to Watson, 1 run, dropped! Short and wide outside off, Watson cuts it firmly to point but a diving effort by Tripathi saves a certain boundary. In fact it was a chance, Tripathi got his hand to it but couldn't take it
Laughlin to Watson, 1 run, 50-run stand up with that single! Short of a length on middle and leg, Watson nudges it away to short mid and scurries across to the other end

Gowtham to Raina, 1 run, a risky single! What was Raina thinking here? Knocks the flatter delivery to the left of the bowler and takes a single. Gowtham had the time in the world to parry it to Rahane but he decides to go for a direct hit and misses out on a run out opportunity. Raina had given up

Andrew Tye to Chawla, 1 run, chance and Mujeeb has dropped a dolly, short and just outside off, Chawla backed away and dabbed it in the air towards short third man. Mujeeb didn't spot it early, the ball was dying in front of him, he bends down low and can't hold on. He then has a shy at the striker's end as the batsmen sneak in a single and misses, but Shubman Gill was always in
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, short of length around off, Pant back cuts it to third man. The 50-run stand comes up and the rebuilding work is done, now they need to kick-on and to get a par total

Stanlake to du Plessis, 1 run, was it a chance? Hooda was the fielder, think the ball bounced just in front of him, nice start from Stanlake, full and well outside off, du Plessis went hard on the drive, gets a thick edge to the right of first slip, Hooda dived to his right and got a hand onto it, saved three runs for his team
Shakib to Raina, 1 run, pushed it through and more importantly cramped Raina for room, knocked to long-on

Shakib to Rayudu, 1 run, fifty for Rayudu. On a surface where all the other batsmen have struggled, he has stroked a flawless half century. The whole team in the dugout stand up to applaud. Tossed up on off, Rayudu wrists it to long-on and reaches the milestone

S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, a direct hit and Rayudu might have been in trouble, he drove one to the right of point and had a stuttered start. Raina was always coming and that forces Rayudu to accelerate. Bhuvi was quick on the ball and has a shy at the bowler's end. He misses with Rayudu well short of making his ground. Rayudu seemed upset with his partner at the calling, turned around towards Raina after completing the single
Karn Sharma to Williamson, 1 run, shimmying down to the pitch of this flighted leg-break, pushes it down to long-off. It's fifty for the SRH captain, but has he given up on this chase?

SN Thakur to Williamson, 1 run, that's a brilliant display of fielding by Karn Sharma in the deep. Times his jump to perfection, plucks his right arm out and grabs it before he parries it into play near the third man fence. Was short and wide outside off as Williamson upper cut it towards third man and Sharma saves five runs for his team with this valiant effort

Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, 143.3kph, low full toss on leg. Kishan with a full face of the bat wrists it to mid-wicket, where Stokes dives across and intercepts it. And that will be a half-century for Kishan. His second IPL fifty. So both batsmen who were dismissed for a first-ball duck in the previous match has made it count today. Raise of the bat from the youngster to soak in the applause from the dug-out

Jofra Archer to Pollard, 1 run, oh, almost had two in two here. Archer drops a tough chance. Fuller ball at 145.1kph just outside off, Pollard smacked it straight back at him, Archer got both hands but it slipped out

Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, put down. Maxwell of all people. Miller decides to go onto his back foot, slaps, uppishly without control and extra-cover couldn't have been found any better. Maxwell's surprised too, and the surprise means there's nobody backing up his throw as well

Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, dropped? Just grazes his fingertips. Fizzes in the quicker one on a fuller length, SKY got forward and got sucked into the drive, he miscued it off the cue end and the ball just evaded Rashid in his followthrough. He did well to bend low, but just couldn't lock his wrists

S Kaul to Bumrah, 1 run, half-a-chance. Seam-up delivery, gets great bounce outside off, Bumrah runs it off the splice of the bat and it evades Dhawan to his right, he dived full length but could only manage a fingertip on that

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, 1 run, dropped by Umesh at extra-cover. Kohli though claps in encouragement. Rayudu moved across to the off-side, skied the lofted hit straight up. Umesh went for the conventional way, straight in and out. Will that prove to be costly?
Dwayne Bravo to Mandeep, 1 run, difficult return catch dropped. Drilled and hit with power to the left-hand of Dwayne Bravo, it didn't stick. Must have stung him, but he doesn't show any emotion
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Manish backs away and punches it to long-off for a single

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, dropped! It took an age for the ball to come down from the sky, and it bursts right through Agarwal's hands in the deep. Another big swipe from Pandey which he mistimes to deep mid-wicket. And another repreive

Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, appeal for run-out. A lazy single from Shakib and this might cost him. Oh dear! Shakib is short, but Ashwin has missed the ball and broke the stumps with his hands, NOT OUT is the call. That's poor cricket all around, the drifter from Ashwin, spun away from outside off, Hasan pushed it to the right of cover-point and set-off for a quick single. He was very casual in his running, took the big steps when he spotted the danger, but was still short of making his ground

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, guided down towards third man. 50 for Prithvi Shaw! Joint youngest to score an IPL fifty. No surprises there if you have heard of him before. A definite prodigy
Cutting to Raina, 1 run, finally a seam-up quick delivery, on the pads, stylishly whipped but on the bounce to deep square

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fuller in length and attacking the stumps, the bat-face is closed to nudge it towards square leg. Off the inside half. This is a good start for MI - 50 in the powerplay!

Unadkat to Williamson, 1 run, fifty for Williamson. Flawless innings from the SRH skipper. Bided his time initially and just stepping the ante now. Nudges it towards mid-wicket, puts on the skates and comes back for the second fuss-free

Ish Sodhi to Hales, 1 run, has Stokes taken this? Ah, nope. He signals he hasn't taken it. But outstanding effort there from the Englishman. Brownie points should be handed there, of course the fairplay points. Googly from Sodhi, lands it full at the stumps. Hales whacked it hard and flat to deep mid-wicket. Stokes stomped forward, dived and went with both hands only for the ball to bobble out of his hands. Hales' heart would've been in his mouth for a second there
Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, sweeps it away to long leg, brings up a fifty

Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, chance and dropped, heads dropped in the RCB camp. It's Murugan Ashwin who has dropped the sitter. Lovely teasing bowling from Chahal, slowed down the pace, this was the leg-break which turned from leg-stump, Lynn was done in by the flight, gets a leading edge towards extra-cover. Ashwin had plenty of time as he ran back from cover, had the ball covered, juggled it twice and shells it

A Russell to Mandeep, 1 run, unbelievable shot from Mandeep under the circumstances. Dropped by Rana running back from short third. Was a short ball outside off, Mandeep left the bat llike a periscope and it looped off the toe, Rana was unsure which way to catch and what hand to use, eventually he circled around it and it went down
Vijay Shankar to Watson, 1 run, doesn't take toll of the Free Hit, Watson. Fuller ball and he wanted to smash hard down the ground. Mistimes it and it flies towards long-off

Avesh Khan to Dhoni, 1 run, dropped! That's a dolly and Munro has spilled it. Short ball and Dhoni pulled it aerially to deep mid-wicket. Didn't connect that well but got lucky in the end. Munro probably didn't pace himself well there but no excuses really. How much will this cost DD?
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, quicker and on leg, turned to deep backward square

McClenaghan to U Yadav, byes, 1 run, Ishan Kishan with the gloves on misses to hit direct and de Grandhomme gets home. McClenaghan beats Yadav with a slower delivery, a swing and a miss but they steal a bye

Hardik Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, bad call from Kohli and Brendon McCullum was gone had Duminy hit from backward point. Dabbed it to the left of the fielder who had already cut off the angle with his movement, Brendon McCullum's bat got stuck in the turf and that didn't help him. Luckily for the Kiwi it didn't hit
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, quicker and on leg, turned to deep backward square

McClenaghan to U Yadav, byes, 1 run, Ishan Kishan with the gloves on misses to hit direct and de Grandhomme gets home. McClenaghan beats Yadav with a slower delivery, a swing and a miss but they steal a bye

Hardik Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, bad call from Kohli and Brendon McCullum was gone had Duminy hit from backward point. Dabbed it to the left of the fielder who had already cut off the angle with his movement, Brendon McCullum's bat got stuck in the turf and that didn't help him. Luckily for the Kiwi it didn't hit

Stokes to Pant, 1 run, slower ball and well wide outside off, Pant tries the slog and mistimes it towards long-on, 6th IPL fifty for Pant. He is in serious form here. This is his fastest IPL fifty as well, getting it off 23 balls and going past the 25-ball fifty vs GL, Rajkot, 2016

Unadkat to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower ball well wide outside off, steered through backward point for a single. 10th IPL fifty for Iyer, almost unnoticed due to the Pant mayhem. It's the fourth for the DD skipper this season and all of them have come in the last five games. Some form!

Cutting to Gayle, 1 run, 24th IPL fifty for Gayle, "He's having a prime time" says Sanjay Manjrekar on air. And there comes the 'Baby in the arms' celebration. Kings XI Punjab owner Preity Zinta is up on her feet applauding. Cutting begins with a cutter on leg, turned gently to short fine leg to bring up the landmark

Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, run-out opportunity missed. An ill-advised single after Stoinis tucked to straight to short mid-wicket and took off for a single. Was always struggling and a direct-hit at the non-striker's end would've been curtains for Stoinis

Cutting to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, kamikaze running from Punjab. Agarwal would've been dismissed for a blob had SKY effected a run-out at the bowler's end. Chopped towards cover, they risk a single and Mayank would've been short by a few inches there, despite him dragging his bat

Markande to Gayle, 1 run, chance, but it was gone even before Markande could get his hands around, Dropped short and just outside off, Gayle stayed back and punched it to the right of the bowler, burst through his hands even before he could react

Hardik Pandya to Yuvraj, 1 run, edged and dropped, short of a length and just outside off, Yuvraj went hard on the cut, gets a thick edge to the right of the keeper. Ishan Kishan didn't get his foot moving, went one-handed as he dived, the ball hit his palms and bounced out
Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, flatter and outside off, chops the cut towards cover and takes Yuvraj on for the single. The shy at the bowler's end misses but I reckon Hardik may have made it

Murugan Ashwin to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, chance and dropped, RCB simply can't afford this, Kohli looks livid, but Chahal is the man who has dropped it. This was tossed up well outside off, Bravo went for his flamboyant inside out drive, didn't bother to keep it down. Chahal did all the hard yards, ran across to his right from sweeper cover, got to the ball and then shelled it as he tumbled onto the ground

Harbhajan to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, pushed through quicker from a good length, worked off the back foot through mid-wicket. 11th IPL fifty for Parthiv Patel! He's been the lone ranger so far with the big names failing. Needs to carry on though

Harbhajan to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, dropped by Bhajji. Slows the pace down, Parthiv Patel's early and pops it back at Bhajji. Slightly to his right, Harbhajan went with both hands and that was his undoing. Got himself into a tangle and was late to react

S Kaul to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, run-out chance at the non-striker's end missed! Why didn't Kaul collect the ball and break the stumps? Had ample time there as Christian had given up. Poked airly to extra cover, KW fires a throw and misses the target. No backing up and they take the single eventually. Skipper gestures to Kaul that he should've collected the ball

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, another fine fifty for Shaw! Has been consistent right throughout. This was a short and low delivery on middle, he flicked that away to deep mid-wicket for a single to reach the milestone

Avesh Khan to Hales, 1 run, Maxi drops a skier. He's having a horrible tournament, not amongst the runs and now puts down a sitter. Hales miscues the pull, gets it high on the bat and sends it high into the night sky. Maxi from deep square leg, runs in and slides with both hands cupped. Straight in and out, embarrasses himself and DD

Plunkett to Y Pathan, 1 run, dropped! Vijay Shankar at deep backward square leg has put down. Probably lost it a bit and was late to go for the catch. Was a shortish ball on leg and Pathan heaved it flat behind square leg. How costly will that be?
Krunal Pandya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower and on off, eased down towards long-on for a single

Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fifty for Yadav. Fourth of the season and it has come against his former team. The sea of blue awaken to applaud the innings and he responds with a wave of the bat. Nudged with the spin past mid-wicket

Nitish Rana to Lewis, 1 run, dropped! That came at a rapid pace and Nitish Rana could only get a hand on it. A full toss and Lewis hammered it straight down the ground. Rana stuck his left hand out and could only parry it towards mid-wicket. A single nabbed

Unadkat to Stoinis, 1 run, direct hit would have got Stoinis! Rahane was the man at extra cover and his reaction says how much RR wanted this. Slower ball that was tapped gently into the off-side, was always a risky run and Stoinis escapes

S Kaul to Mandeep, 1 run, the inside edge saves him. An inswinging full ball on middle and leg, crashes into Mandeep's back pad as he sets up to slog. They'll take the single towards backward point. What an over from Kaul. Brilliant death bowling

Rashid Khan to Vohra, 1 run, Kaul spills a dolly! He had enough time to judge this but rushed into the catch and eventually, it slipped and crashed into his neck before falling to the ground. Was a quickish delivery and Vohra mistimed the pull due to the bounce. Kaul from deep backward square leg anticipated it well and got to it nicely as well, just couldn't complete the job. Vohra lucky in the end. How much will this cost SRH?

Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, tossed up outside off, pushed to deep cover. 50 for KW. What a player and captain he has been for SRH. And to think that he wouldn't have got in had Warner been here. Fifth fifty of the IPL and once again he is shepherding this innings
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 1 run, yorker on the stumps this time, Rahul opens the face of the bat to point. Quick single but Stoinis makes it in
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, shuffles to take it on the pads, and tickles it to short fine. What's more - it's a fifty, stealing the opening spot

A Russell to Rohit, 1 run, dropped! Nitish Rana is the culprit. That has to be taken at this level. Rohit saw the line outside off and threw his bat hard at it. Sliced it over backward point and the ball went quickly to the fielder there. Rana could not hold on to it. How costly is that going to be?

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, direct-hit would have been curtains for Hardik Pandya! Short of a length, Pandya cross-bats it to extra cover and he gave up as he was sprinting towards the other end. Chawla missed the target at the bowler's end and Pandya survives

Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, 1 run, that could have been a soft dismissal. Was a tossed up delivery and Rohit chipped it straight back. Kuldeep was quick to move to his left and put in the dive but the ball just eludes him

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, 1 run, 50-run stand up for the fourth wicket. How pivotal has this knock by the youngster been. Short of a length outside off and Pant does well to slap it to cover, a slight misfield too but the batsmen are satisfied with the single

Boult to Williamson, 1 run, run-out chance missed. KW had almost given up. Nothing going DD's way at the moment. Squeezed to point and they take on Iyer's throw, who misses the target at the non-striker's end

Jofra Archer to Raina, 1 run, another fifty for Raina. He continues to keep piling on runs against the Royals. This was a short delivery again and Raina helps it around the corner to reach his milestone. His job is not done yet though. Would be interesting to see how he deals with the spinners from here on

Unadkat to Raina, 1 run, run-out missed. Raina was a goner. Backs away to leg and is made to reach out to his slower short of length delivery, chops the cut towards cover and sets off, Rahane had one stump to aim and he misses. Raina was gone by a fair distance there

Watson to Buttler, 1 run, clears his front leg and smacks this slower ball straight at Watson, who tried putting his hands together in front of his face but it burst through them. Half a chance, if you want to be harsh

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 1 run, dropped by Dhoni. Could have been the match right there. Fine leg is inside the ring, which tempts Buttler into looking for the scoop. But this is a slower ball, making it really difficult to get any leverage on it. He deflects it to Dhoni's left, who dives with one hand but can't cling on

Barinder to Uthappa, 1 run, a direct hit there and it was curtains for Narine. He was nowhere in the frame and had given up. Short of a length around off, Uthappa chops it to short third man, calls for a single and completes it. Mohit Sharma is the one who fails to score the direct hit
Andrew Tye to Karthik, 1 run, inches short of a yorker and he's squeezed it out to backward point. Karthik's 15th IPL fifty - and his first this season

Axar to Narine, 1 run, third fifty for Narine in IPL and second one this season. Nudges the floater away to deep mid-wicket to reach his milestone. But he needs to carry on. Usually throws it away after reaching fifty

A Russell to Gayle, 1 run, dropped by Karthik. A leading edge kinda top-edge there as Gayle looked to run it into the leg-side. Looped behind, DK leaped but deflected it off the tip of his gloves. A bit high that but it'll be recorded as a drop
Prasidh to Rahul, 1 run, 50 up. Length ball at 143ks, worked effortlessly through mid-wicket
Moeen Ali to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, 50 partnership! Gets there with a flick off the pads to short fine
de Grandhomme to Pant, 1 run, slapped back. Would have been a brilliant reaction catch from de Grandhomme. Sticks his right hand out and only manages to cut some pace on that

de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dropped by AB. Didn't pick that clearly. At least that's what he's indicating to VK. Iyer tried to loft this straight, ended up hitting it miles in the air and it hung in for an eternity. AB backtracked all the way from covers, but ended up swirling all around it before grazing the ball off his fingertips
Mishra to Kohli, 1 run, flat and short enough for Kohli to go back and tuck into the on-side towards long-on

Shakib to Dhoni, 1 run, I can't believe my eyes. Manish Pandey has dropped a sitter by his standards. It's MS Dhoni too! Pandey is one of SRH's finest fielders. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Dhoni steps out and mistimes the loft, hit flat to long-on, Pandey was close to the rope, took it too casually and it popped out

Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, 1 run, that's it! Maiden IPL hundred. The crowd roars. What a knock from Ambati Rayudu. He takes the helmet off, raises the bat and enjoys the moment with a big smile. He has been exceptional this season. The teams applauds and Dhoni congratulates him too. Short of a length delivery on the leg stump, Rayudu moves across and works it towards square leg
Jadeja to Dhawan, 1 run, another 50-run stand up between these two. This was a short delivery and Dhawan pulled it down to long-on

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, 1 run, and that's fifty for SRH's skipper Williamson. His 10th IPL fifty. Continuing from where he left off from the last game. Eases a single to long-off and reaches the milestone, raises his bat to soak in the applause from the dug-out

Unadkat to Cutting, 1 run, dropped! Archer puts down a sitter. Warne is livid in the dugout but he isn't showing any emotions. Cutting was deceived completely by the slower delivery and miscues the big hit towards point, Archer was a bit too casual with his approach and hence spills it
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, digs out a drive, almost drilling it past mid-off. Almost. Because Stokes is swooping down, releasing before he collects. A direct hit and Yadav was going back
Markande to Rahane, 1 run, a low full toss in trying to bowl flat from over the wicket, Rahane pats it to long-on to bring the 50-run stand up

Rajpoot to Kohli, 1 run, dropped! Finch the culprit at mid-off, was late to trek backward and in the end, he did get a hand on it but spilled it. Low full toss from Rajpoot that Kohli mistimed. The loft came off the toe end and eventually, he got lucky. Second life for the skipper

Andrew Tye to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, Kohli survives easily in the end. Looked closer to the naked eye but when KXIP reviewed it, Hawk Eye showed it to be missing leg stump comfortably. Fuller ball that angled into Kohli, he was on the shuffle and missed the flick. Looked really close initially, not to be

Stokes to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, it slams the pad. Buttler seems to be jumping up in appeal. Stokes is busy trying to clean up the possible leg bye. Oh Rajasthan have to take it up. It's all up to the angle .. how big is it getting? Okay so DK has missed the glance, he's stuck in front of middle. And yes, HawkEye shows it clipping the edge of the bail. Everyone's happy

Shivam Mavi to R Tripathi, 1 run, dropped! Fired in on a short of length @144.8kmph, angling in towards leg, Tripathi is intimidated and tentatively defends off the back foot, gets an edge to third man for a single as Rana drops it at slip... Went flying for it two-handed but no dice
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, 102kph, Rahul knocks it down to long-on to bring up yet another fifty this season. What a time he's having

Bumrah to Finch, 1 run, back of a length, Finch is hopping back in the crease as he defends it to the left of short mid-wicket, so he really has to put the skates on as he bolts towards the non-striker's end. McClenaghan throws himself forward as he releases the ball in one motion along with the dive, but Finch gets there
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, slightly short, Rahul is early into it as it stuck in the pitch a little, carved to cover where Cutting makes an excellent effort but drops it!

Siraj to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, dropped! How many dropped catches tonight? And second drop for the skipper. The length ball was delivered for the batsman to send it to the moon. But the batsman lifted it up without any distance for the man at long-off to come in but he dropped it

Mishra to Rayudu, 1 run, full and flighted outside off, Rayudu gets forward and pushes to mid-off, takes off for a risky run, and Maxi is quick to fire in the throw to the non-striker's end. Rayudu was gone if that had hit. Not even in the frame! Where was Mishra?

Harshal Patel to Rayudu, 1 run, another full one on off-and-middle, and a punch from the crease to long-on for a single, to bring up yet another 50 for Rayudu in this IPL. He's knocked the door down to get into the Indian side, and his batting epiphany continues

Jadeja to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, a drop! Shardul Thakur is the culprit. Shaw once again kneels down to employ the slog sweep against an in-dart. Mistimed and went to the right of mid-on, where Thakur leapt and couldn't snaffle

Jofra Archer to Chahal, leg byes, 1 run, that was a comedy of errors? The yorkerish delivery was missed by the batsman and was hit on the boot. It was going down leg and the bowler kept on appealing. Number 10 and Jack decided to steal a single and they did. The keeper could not manage to throw the sticks down at the bowler's end, else it could have been tight
Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Tripathi jumps and cuts to deep point. Brings up the 50-run stand between the duo

Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, Tripathi sees the width on this short of length delivery and punches on the rise. Falls short of backward point, where Mandeep dove forward. Collects and has a shy at the striker's end. Doesn't hit the target, Rahane would have been in anyway
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, 50 run stand. Shakib adjusts, bowling this arm-ball slow and full. To long-on for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, buzz in the crowd as Dhawan reaches his fifty. 32nd IPL fifty for the southpaw, mind you he was averaging around 24 against KKR before this game. A flighted delivery just outside off and Dhawan thrashes it to long-off to bring up the milestone

Searles to Dhawan, 1 run, had Searles hit the target, Goswami might have been struggling. Dhawan set off for a quick single after nudging the ball towards short mid-wicket. Searles was quick on his follow-through, ran across Goswami, got to the ball and then fired a throw at the striker's end, he missed with Goswami way short of his crease

Mustafizur to Pant, 1 run, Mustafizur keeps it full and just outside off, driven back at the bowler who gets a hand onto it and deflects it away towards long-on, that single raises another fifty for Pant - who also has the orange cap back with him

Bumrah to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, chance and dropped, Rohit is wriggling in pain, but he gets up and it seems to be all OK. Coming to the ball, it was a high full-toss that was sliced to the left of backward point. Rohit tumbled across and think the ball hit him high on the arm

Cutting to Pant, 1 run, slower shot one, Pant is early into the pull and gets a thick under edge towards square leg for a single. A throw at the striker's end, and a direct-hit. The umpire goes up to his ally upstairs, but all is well.

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, that left shoulder will certainly be tested with the dive. Pushed it through and got the ball to grip, Pandya squirts it off the outer half to the left of Iyer at cover, Rohit called for the single and had to put in the dive to make his ground. Direct hit might have made things more interesting

Boult to Cutting, 1 run, direct hit and Markande was a goner. Low full toss and Cutting shuffled across and tried to help it round the corner, found the fielder at short fine and pushed Markande for the single, he wanted to retain the strike. Markande was not even in the frame as Lamichhane missed the sticks

Boult to Markande, 1 run, direct hit and that was over. Cutting went for the single and he was not even in the frame. Full delivery and Markande digs the drive out to cover, the pair had to go and Shaw was the fielder. Took his time and fired a throw at the striker's end. Missed and Mumbai stay alive. Pant also came charging forward and slipped while collecting the ball. Had he stayed on his feet and collected it cleanly, Cutting was still gone

Harshal Patel to Lewis, 1 run, in the airr and Vijay Shankar shells it down. It was a tough chance as Lewis had hammered it hard. And guess what? Lewis could've still been dismissed had Iyer - who was backing up, effected a direct-hit at the non-striker's end. Lewis had given up

Mohit Sharma to Raina, 1 run, tucks the length delivery to square leg and calls for a risky single. Had this been a direct hit at the striker's end, Bhajji was gone. Miller was the fielder and he could have taken some more time before having a go
Dwayne Bravo to Miller, 1 run, slower ball, full on leg, wristed to mid-wicket and the charging in fielder - Thakur slides and loses his balance. Luckily, no damage
A Russell to Samson, 1 run, the partnership between Samson and Rahane is now 50. Uppish tuck to an in-ducker and has been fielded at deep mid. A single
Chawla to Samson, 1 run, uppish tuck, awkwardly done but fifty it is from the young man. In the night of the eliminator, he has come good. Gutsy knock from him

S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, 1 run, this is unbelievable bowling under pressure. Yorker on off, Mavi jams it to short cover and then they run, because they have to, and not because it was on. Direct-hit would have ended Gill and with him, KKR's hopes

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, 1 run, back of a length delivery on the hips, dropped off the back foot to square leg where Williamson picks up and throws at the non-striker's end. He wasn't even in the frame when the ball crossed the stumps. Terrible running from Rana

Shivam Mavi to Saha, 1 run, chance and dropped, DK with the big gloves called for the catch, Lynn - who was very near the ball moved away and then the captain shells it. That's a bad miss from DK, coming to the ball, it was another ugly slog from Saha, got it off the toe-end, very high and towards square leg. Karthik had plenty of time, but the ball seemed to swirl away at the very end and that perhaps put him off
Chawla to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up well outside off, Dhawan bends down low and sweeps it towards deep mid-wicket for a single

Rashid Khan to Watson, 1 run, take a bow, Shane Robert Watson. He becomes the fourth player to have two or more hundreds in an IPL season. If at all you are struggling in life, just watch this innings folks. This is a serious life lesson. He couldn't time the ball, was only hitting it to hand, was getting beaten, his first run came off the 11th ball he faced, but he didn't lose heart. Backed himself like his captain always does and he now has a hundred off 51 balls. When his trigger is that slight movement backwards with a gentle hop of the front leg, you know as a bowler he's in the zone. He switched gears and muscled all the bowlers around. The hundred ball though was just a gentle push to the left of cover and off comes the helmet, great applause from the crowd and the CSK dugout and soaks them all in with his hands aloft
Jadeja to Dhawan, 1 run, starts from over the wicket and lands it full, Dhawan works it to long-on and brings up the 50-run stand
Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 126.9kph, solid crunchy front-footed drive, through point. Also, quite neat to get to his fifty -- his sixth IPL one

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, a sitter .. and dropped. Yusuf Pathan of all people. Uthappa's done in in his desperate attempt to make room and hoick one downtown. Has absolutely no control, and Pathan has all the time in the world to settle under at long-on, wait, and then let the ball slip through

Nitish Rana to Bairstow, 1 run, chance and Gill has dropped it, would have been a fine catch - he did well to get to the ball, had to go one handed, parried it in the air and then couldn't get across on the rebound - would have been a screamer had he held on. Coming to the ball, Bairstow backed away to a well flighted delivery and drilled it inside out - wide of cover
Nitish Rana to Warner, 1 run, slower and just outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single, raises SRH's 100
K Paul to Yuvraj, 1 run, shortish and outside off, Yuvraj delays the dab to get it down to third man

Sam Curran to Smith, 1 run, full and sliding on leg-stump, Smith missed the flick and got a tiny bit of under-edge onto the pad. Ashwin went up for the review after a chat with his bowler, but to no avail
