Harbhajan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, in the airrrrr but it drops short of Dududu Rayudu. But he does extremely well to get his hand behind the line and save the boundary. Shreyas Iyer steps out and flicks without control, gets away with it as it lands right in front of deep mid-wicket

Harbhajan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, in the airrrrr but it drops short of Dududu Rayudu. But he does extremely well to get his hand behind the line and save the boundary. Shreyas Iyer steps out and flicks without control, gets away with it as it lands right in front of deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, low full toss on the stumps, Rana pushes it down to long-on and brings up the 50-run stand

Chahal to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, Chahal has put down a return catch! A tossed up leggie and Krunal Pandya pushes with hard hands. The bowler went with both hands moving to his left, but the ball doesn't stick

Siraj to de Kock, 1 run, oh close! Risky single attempted and de Kock had to dive full-length to make his ground. Tucked into the leg-side and got the nod from his skipper. Siraj swiftly moved across and collected the ball before hurling the stumps at the non-striker's end, that was a nervy moment for de Kock
Bumrah to de Villiers, 1 run, 29th IPL fifty for AB de Villiers! Punches a length ball square of sweeper cover and gets to the landmark with an air of nonchalance

Malinga to Shivam Dube, 1 run, dropped! Bumrah is the culprit. Slower length delivery outside off, Dube slices it high into the air and it kept swirling backwards behind the keeper, Bumrah runs back from short third but can't cling onto it

Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, fifty for Rahane. First of the season for the skipper. Just a quick bat raise towards his team and on his goes.. Wrong 'un and on the shorter length, tucked away in front of square on the leg-side

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, 1 run, fifty for Samson. 11th in the league and Rajasthan's mentor, Shane Warne picked him as the player to watch out for in this edition. He's started off nicely. Picked the slower delivery and works it into the open mid-wicket area
Nadeem to Samson, 1 run, miscued front-footed pull. Straight to long-on. Also, the 50-stand between these two

Stokes to Bairstow, 1 run, dropped by Kulkarni at third man! Short one just outside off, angling in, Bairstow stays low and gets under it, runs his hands through the upper-cut, Dhawal runs from third man in to take the catch but fluffs it - concedes a single
Stokes to Warner, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads @138.4km/h, clipped away to backward square leg for a single - and that brings up the half-century opening partnership!
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, pushes it with the spin to deep cover and he will retain the strike

Shami to Yuvraj, 1 run, cramps Yuvraj with this good length ball, stabbed towards extra cover for a sharp run. 50-run stand comes up! Valuable one for MI who now have the platform to launch at the death

Shankar to de Grandhomme, 1 run, Bhuvi drops a straightforward catch at extra cover but SRH won't mind match. Williamson and Co. are in all smiles at the dug-out. Hammered airly, went straight to Bhuvi, who mistimed his jump and ended up shelling it

Sandeep Sharma to Siraj, 1 run, anti-climax. Nabi puts down a tough chance at long-off. Siraj miscues the pull and Nabi comes charging in from long-off, bends forward and gets both hands but fails to hold onto it

Stokes to Dhoni, 1 run, 132kph, Dhoni dances down the ground and batters it to the right of extra cover. It travelled quickly to Gowtham and he failed to hold onto it. Would be very harsh to call it a drop
Santner to Smith, 1 run, banged in on a back of a length, angling into the pads, tucked off the pads towards wide long-on for a single - 50-run partnership between these two

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, no ball, 1 run, so many things happening on one ball. Lets first acknowledge Parthiv's fifty. A fine knock on a surface where the rest have struggled. And whatsmore it is his fastest IPL fifty. Now to the rest of the ball: Archer oversteps to deliver the slower ball, dabbed to short third and Parthiv wanted a single, Stoinis sends him back and he makes it just in time as there was a direct hit, the deflection forces Stoinis to go for the run and they steal it in the end quite comfortably

Navdeep Saini to Rahane, 1 run, edged and dropped. That's an early chance that goes begging for RCB and Saini can't do much because it's the skipper Virat Kohli who puts it down. Short of a length and held its line just outside off, Rahane chased with no feet and feeds an outside edge that flew very quickly to first slip where Virat was standing a bit wide. The RCB skipper moved swiftly to his right, got both hands but grasses it. Probably, didn't anticipate it to come so quickly at him

Chahal to Smith, 1 run, dropped! No, RR don't want to bat sensibly. Smith decides to go after this flighted delivery outside off from Chahal with an inside-out loft. Doesn't middle and hits it straight to sweeper cover, where Umesh decides to be generous and puts down a dolly! Oh, RCB!

Siraj to Smith, 1 run, Negi dives forward at mid-wicket, but fails to hold onto it. Short ball and Smith pulls of the top part of the bat, it kept dipping at the fielder, but carried to Negi. Tough chance
Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, another drop! Short again and Tripathi gets a top-edge on his pull, Moeen runs to his right from deep mid-wicket and slides, fails to snaffle it. Dew factor?

SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, steers it wide of backward point and they will take a single. Dhoni fumbles and Hardik Pandya wanted a double, MS quickly recovered and had he hit at the non striker's end, Pandya would have been in trouble

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Ingram had given up. Iyer taps it in front of point and sets off, Ingram had to respond and he just hoped Pandey missed, he did and the southpaw survives. It was not far though

Stoinis to Chris Lynn, 1 run, Siraj puts down a sitter! Will this be the decisive moment in this game? RCB will hope not. It's a massive though, it's Lynn. Smart from Stoinis as he kept this slower ball wider outside off, forced Lynn to reach it and the result was a miscue that flew at a comfortable height to sweeper cover. Siraj had it covered and then let it pop out. VK is livid
Narine to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, 50-partnership comes up! Parthiv Patel steers it wide of short third for a single
Sam Curran to du Plessis, 1 run, short, but nothing at all on the ball. du Plessis has to wait, wait some more, and then when he pulls, drags it away into the leg-side with no timing whatsoever
Tahir to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, Sarfaraz Khan knocks it down to long-off. And he will reach his maiden IPL fifty with it. He is finally coming off age
Harbhajan to Rahul, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, works it to long-on. And he will bring up his fifty too, he is palying the role of anchor to perfection here, needs to carry on for his team

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, 1 run, and Kaul has dropped it. Lost it in the lights may be or might have been the swirling ball coming down. Eventful first over. Rohit danced out, looked to loft, got a big fat outer-edge and the man at deep third dropped it. The fielder did not even get a hand to it

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 1 run, in the air and Rashid grasses it. Instantly puts his hand up and apologises. Another cutter, thrown outside off. Pollard flashes his bat and spanks it towards sweeper cover. Rashid runs across, covers good ground in getting towards the ball but unfortunately can't hold onto it as he slides. Bhuvneshwar is not happy

Rahul Chahar to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Pollard drops a dolly at long-off. Can you believe it, I can't. Let me pinch myself. Yes, Pollard has dropped. It was a miscued loft from Manish Pandey, was in the air for a long time. Pollard comes under it but for some reason fails to grab it. Rohit is stunned

Alzarri Joseph to Manish Pandey, 1 run, direct hit and Shankar would have been gone. Manish Pandey taps it to cover and charges for a single. Surya picks it up cleanly but fails to nail the direct hit at the striker's end. And Shankar survives!

Southee to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dropped by Parthiv! That could possibly have been the second wicket of the innings, but Southee has his hands on his head. The keeper has let him down. Iyer went for a drive away from his body as an outside edge flies straight to the keeper. Parthiv dives to his right, gets his glove to it but fails to cling on to the catch. Quite an eventful over that

Chris Morris to de Villiers, 1 run, a direct hit at the bowler's end and AB would have been running to the pavilion. It was his call after he drove it straight to mid-off. The fielder had time to shy and then missed, AB was a long way away from safety had he hit

Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, and that might have been an outer edge! Kept low and went between the keeper's legs for a single. Fifty for Lynn. He has set it up for KKR for a big win. Needed this knock to bolster his confidence as well

D Kulkarni to Narine, 1 run, Tripathi has dropped a sitter and Kulkarni can't believe it. Got deceived due to the slower delivery as he was early in his chip. The ball was in the air for an eternity and Tripathi, at point, had all the time to get under it. Gets his hands to it and spills it out

Kuldeep Yadav to Smith, 1 run, a certain chance has gone down here..pushed the googly into the off-side and set off. The man at cover rushed in, had a flick on to the sticks but missed it. Smith survives
Gurney to Buttler, 1 run, another slower delivery and Buttler is happy with a push down the ground, 50-run stand up
S Kaul to Agarwal, 1 run, 5th IPL fifty for Mayank Agarwal! Gets there with a tickle off his pads through square leg
Rashid Khan to Rahul, 1 run, stabs the ball out with soft hands into the off-side and gets a single. Fifty of the partnership comes up as well
Sam Curran to Warner, 1 run, the partnership between Warner and Manish Pandey is now 50. Lowish full toss on the pads. The best that Warner can do is whip it away to deep mid for a single
Rajpoot to Shankar, 1 run, close! Shortens the length and Shankar taps it to the left of backward point, Miller has a shy at the striker's end and he misses, Warner might have been in trouble there

Kuggeleijn to A Russell, 1 run, Jaddu nearly took a blinder at deep mid-wicket. Very hard to call this a drop but Russell continues to ride his luck. Banged in short outside off, Russell stays back and pulls it hard towards deep mid-wicket. Jadeja was a few yards inside the ropes, sees the ball sailing over his head so he backtracks and uses his one hand to keep it on. The momentum was taking him over the ropes, so he couldn't quite cling onto it. But certainly saved some runs for his team. Brilliant from Jaddu
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, eases this full ball to extra cover, thus bringing up his fifty with a quick single
Bumrah to Rahul, 1 run, runs it down to third man. 50-run partnership comes up! These two are looking ominous for Mumbai
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, very full and wide of off, Rahul went for a reverse, ended up missing it. It might have clipped his edge, it deflects off QDK to the leg-side

Viljoen to de Kock, 1 run, dropped down the leg-side. Second drop of the innings. This might turn out to be costly for KXIP. Short ball, down leg, de Kock goes for the pull and gets a glove. The ball flies fine and Rahul got both hands to it diving to his right but spilled it. The two batters steal a single as well. And to make matters worse, a bout of cramps seem to have engulfed Rahul. He seems to be in some agonising pain

Chris Morris to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 2nd IPL fifty for Gill! First innings as an opener and he's grabbed the opportunity. This kid is class apart and it's only a matter of time before he proves that. Good knock so far and will want to bat deep. Reaches the landmark with a slice down to third man

Ishant to Shubman Gill, 1 run, a direct hit might have been interesting - Shubman pushed this one in front of mid-on and called for a quick single - it was always a dicey single - Shreyas was quick on the ball and has a shy - had he hit, Shubman would have been short, despite the dive

Unadkat to de Kock, 1 run, eighth IPL fifty for de Kock - second this season. Unadkat pulls his length back, de Kock has ample time to muscle the pull to deep mid-wicket. Just a raise of the bat from the southpaw

Jofra Archer to de Kock, leg byes, 1 run, good yorker, follows de Kock who was backing away. Off the right boot towards short fine leg. Direct hit would have gotten Pollard who was lazy as he ambled in

Behrendorff to Buttler, 1 run, fifty for Buttler. He holds the key to this run chase for both sides. The longer he stays the better for Rajasthan, but not for Mumbai. Fuller and outside off, Buttler is happy to push it down to long-off and take the single
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, 1 run, delivers this by coming in between the umpire, Buttler nudges it to mid-wicket

Rahul Chahar to Samson, 1 run, that sums up the kind of day Mumbai are having. Sliced up in the air off the outside half, falls right between extra cover and sweeper cover. Rohit may have fallen on his face while diving back. He looks to be all right

Bumrah to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, dropped by Ishan Kishan! Back of a length around off, Gopal is squared up while moving around in the crease, gets a healthy outside edge. Would've been a sharp catch. Kishan dives full stretched to his right but puts it down

U Yadav to Gayle, 1 run, Kohli spills a dolly! An extremely unusually sight, especially when he is fielding in the deep. Gayle mistimed this low full toss and hit it flat towards long-on. Was a regulation take for VK who timed his run forward properly, only to let it through in the end. Poor!
Siraj to Mandeep, 1 run, short of a length, follows Mandeep who mistimes the heave towards deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Gayle, 1 run, fifty for Gayle. He continues his fine form.. Third of the season and this against his old team. Just a bat raise and on he goes.. Turning into the big man and Gayle is happy to nudge it square on the leg-side

Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, fifty for Kohli! A different bowling action from Ashwin as he bowls a fullish ball outside off. Drilled to long-on for a single and Kohli points at his team's symbol on the shirt before rasing his bat

Tye to Stoinis, 1 run, Murugan Ashwin drops a skier! The nightmare in the field continues for Kings XI. Back of a length outside off, Stoinis looks to hoick through midwicket but gets a thick top-edge that goes way up in the air, giving Murugan plenty of time to settle underneath. Almost too much time. He makes a meal of it

Tye to de Villiers, 1 run, full and wide, creamed to extra cover where Ashwin does a brilliant job of a pick-up and throw. A direct-hit might've even had him, or maybe not. He's in, well in. And that's his fifty too. The job's not done yet though
Prasidh to Raina, 1 run, short of length, Raina hops back and tucks this through square leg for his fifty. Much appreciation shown from the CSK dugout
Tahir to Chris Lynn, 1 run, fifty for Lynn, his 8th in IPL, the leg-break from Tahir, but the length was short, allowed Lynn to go back and cut it towards backward point
K Paul to Bairstow, 1 run, low full toss on middle, eased down to long-on

Bumrah to Moeen Ali, 1 run, waits on the slower delivery by hanging on to the back foot but inside halves the ball away into the on-side for a single. Fifty for Moeen Ali as well. This has been one cracking innings from the English all-rounder. Has delighted the crowd with some luscious big hits. Even Kohli gets up and applauds this quick fifty
Ashwin to R Tripathi, 1 run, flighted around off, Tripathi pulls to deep mid-wicket and that'll be his first fifty this IPL
Ashwin to Samson, 1 run, wide on the crease again is Ashwin, straightens it on off stump, it takes a thick edge from Samson before rolling to short third man
Nadeem to du Plessis, 1 run, 50-run stand up between the openers as du Plessis tucks this one through mid-wicket off an inside edge

Malinga to Rabada, 1 run, dropped - Pollard of all people, and the simplest take of them all. Rabada goes on a knee, swings, top-edges, skies. Pollard meanwhile runs in from long-on, casually, settles, gets both palms and then lets it pop out

Steyn to Chris Lynn, 1 run, dropped first ball! 140ks away swinger from Steyn and Chris Lynn was caught poking without any feet movement, a thick edge flies to the right of Stoinis at first slip who gets a hand but fails to cling onto it
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, 1 run, biffed away to long-off and that brings the 50-run stand between the duo

Prasidh to Kohli, 1 run, fullish just outside off, Kohli drives it to mid-off and takes the single. Fifty for Kohli, his 37th half-century in the IPL and he gets a rousing reception from the Kolkata crowd. The RCB dug-out stands and applauds, Kohli waves his bat around to soak it all in

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, Archer drops his second catch of the match! de Kock scored 65, how much will Hardik score? He had slogged the length delivery to deep mid-wicket where Jofra puts down a sitter. Not a great day for him in the outfield

Shreyas Gopal to de Kock, 1 run, a chance and Jofra Archer can't quite hold on, it was always going to be tough - he came running in from long-on, slid forward, goth both hands and then the ball bounced out. A mistimed heave from de Kock as he looked to break the shackles - got it horribly wrong and nearly was dismissed

Rahul Chahar to Smith, 1 run, knocked out to mid-on, where Chahar is quick to run across, swoop low, gather and then fire it back at the non-striker's as well. A direct hit would've ruined all of Smith's hard work
Rahul Chahar to Riyan Parag, 1 run, high wide full toss, carved away through sweeper
Murugan Ashwin to Dhawan, 1 run, knocks this googly in front of point for a quick single. Brings up his fifty too which is greatly appreciated by his teammates as well as the home crowd

Shami to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, skipper leading from the front, brings up his 12th fifty in IPL. Gets a standing ovation from his team mates in the dug-out. Has been a responsible knock by the lad. Hooks the short ball to deep mid-wicket and gets to the milestone. Gets there and raises his bat to acknowledge the crowd
Ashwin to Dhawan, 1 run, pulled away to deep midwicket

Lamichhane to Mandeep, 1 run, dropped! Rabada apologises. Half tracker and Mandeep could have hit it anywhere, instead he swivels and pulls it to deep backward square, Rabada misjudged it badly and tracked back before running in, dived forward and got his hands to it. But the ball did not stick. That would have been an impressive end to Lamichhane's spell

Mishra to Gayle, 1 run, fifty for Gayle. He shows the sticker on his bat that says - Universe Boss. Job not done as Punjab need to bat deep and take them to a competitive total. Wrong 'un around leg-stump and Gayle sweeps it to deep backward square

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 1 run, direct hit and Karthik was gone. Hesitation between the two batsmen and it was the KKR skipper who was in trouble. He tried to force the good length delivery through the off-side and mishit it towards point, started to go for the single before stopping, Lynn kept going and that left Karthik with no choice. He put in a desparate dive but Shankar's throw was not on target

Yarra Prithviraj to Bairstow, 1 run, Chawla at deep square drops one now. Oh KKR! This is shambolic. Young Yarra Prithviraj has another drop off his bowling. Not his day. Short ball, Bairstow goes for the pull, gets a top-edge and the ball stayed in the air for an eternity. Chawla though never got anywhere close
Cariappa to Warner, 1 run, length ball outside off, slapped to deep point. It's the fourth 100-run stand that these two have put up this season. Incredible!

Narine to Bairstow, 1 run, Bairstow's turn. More cheers from the crowd. This is a celebration going on, not a run chase. Clipped off the pads backward of square. For all their brutality otherwise, they've brought up fifties with innocent singles
U Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, length ball on middle and leg, nudged quietly through midwicket

Steyn to du Plessis, 1 run, slower delivery and was ill-timed to mid-off. Faf wanted a single and set off. ABD had to get the direct hit in but didn't take his time to throw the sticks down. Faf was gone for all money

SN Thakur to de Villiers, 1 run, oh! Faf almost pulls off a stunner. This would have been the catch of the tournament. de Villiers struck the off-drive uppishly towards mid-off, Faf times his jump perfectly and goes with one hand, it doesn't stick

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, Ashton Turner is having a nightmare. After three ducks in a row, he's now put down a skier. Thick top-edge on the pull shot from Shaw, Turner went back from position at midwicket to get under it, but it bounced off his palms

Riyan Parag to Dhawan, 1 run, driven off the back foot wide of Smith at extra cover. Good effort there with the dive, but can only make a half-stop, not enough to stop Dhawan from getting to his fifty. He's gone a few notches higher in these last few games
Mishra to Smith, 1 run, skates down and flicks the flatter delivery off his pads to deep mid-wicket. 100-run partnership's up
Chris Morris to Smith, 1 run, biffed to mid-off and that'll be Steven Smith's 8th IPL fifty

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, 1 run, dropped by Bairstow! It was a meaty outside edge from Watson, who was looking to swing through the line of this full ball. Bairstow dives to his right, goes with one hand, but it doesn't stick
Tahir to Warner, 1 run, quicker on middle and leg, tucked away into the leg-side and that'll be 43rd IPL fifty for David Warner

Chahar to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Raina drops a sitter! Not only his batting, but his fielding hasn't been great either. A couple of misfields earlier in the innings and now he puts one down. Pandey got deceived due to the slower delivery as he miscued it towards mid-off where Raina fails to cling on to the catch

Dwayne Bravo to Warner, 1 run, sharp bumper on the face, Warner was surprised by how quickly it came to him. He mistimes the pull totally and ends up hitting it just to the left of the side wicket. Bravo charges quickly towards but fails to pick up the ball cleanly. And he is gutted with himself

U Yadav to Pooran, 1 run, the horror IPL for RCB in the field continues. It was a sitter, an absolute sitter. Kohli must be livid, he has turned his face away from the camera. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Pooran fails to time the heave. It was in the air for an eternity and Stoinis at long-on had all the time in the world to settle himself. He spills it though

U Yadav to Murugan Ashwin, 1 run, dropped! Kohli drops a dolly. He might have been more worried about the celebration. Slower one on the stumps, Murugan Ashwin is completely deceived and he still goes through with the big hit, mistimes it towards long-on and the RCB skipper makes a mess of it

Jofra Archer to A Russell, 1 run, dropped! Oh no Stuart! That is the last thing you want to do to a batsman like Russell. Slower short of length delivery outside off, Russell delays his slap and still hits it straight to sweeper cover, Binny bends down and lets it slip out of his grasp. How costly would that be?

Thomas to Karthik, 1 run, fifty for Karthik. He needed this. KKR needed this. They needed their captain back in form and leading from the front and Karthik has done just that today. Back of a length around off, Karthik waits and steers it down to third man

Thomas to A Russell, 1 run, dropped! Once is a sin. What do you call dropping a guy like Russell twice? Prashant Chopra, on as a substitute, puts down the skier. Short of length outside off, Russell had to reach out for his muscled hoick to leg and all he could manage was a toe-end straight up, Chopra circles underneath near point and spills it. Smith is not a happy captain
Anukul Roy to Shorey, 1 run, drills the full toss back at Roy who got both hands at it, but it was hit really hard and just burst through. Half a chance

Santner to Rohit, 1 run, fifty for Rohit. First of the season and first in a long time. His last fifty also came against Chennai last year. He is set now and got the milestone out of the way, needs to launch to get Mumbai to a good total. He eases it wide of cover and calls for the single, there was a bit of confusion but they get it easily in the end

Binny to Manish Pandey, 1 run, drilled back to the bowler, who parries towards extra cover and that allows Manish Pandey to take the single. Back-to-back fifties for Pandey! He certainly likes to bat at No. 3!
Thomas to Shankar, 1 run, taps a length ball to short cover and sets off for a risky single. Parag fails to hit the target at the striker's end

Unadkat to Shakib, 1 run, dropped! Short ball angled around the ribcage, Shakib was cramped for room and despite that he decided to go for the pull, sends it off the thick top-edge and Varun Aaron can't hold on at short fine. He dived to his left but couldn't gather the ball cleanly

Shivam Dube to Dhawan, 1 run, brings up his fifty now! Wanted to sweep it to the on-side, gets an inside edge. And it hits his pads and deflects to the off-side, good enough for a single. Third consecutive fifty for Shikhar. After an average start to the tournament, he has lifted his form brilliantly for the team
U Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, once again Dhawan steps out of his crease, this time to play an uppish drive. Made decent connection, but luckily it falls short of a forward-diving mid-off fielder
Washington Sundar to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan cuts it wide of backward point for a single and 50-run partnership comes up.
Bumrah to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fifty for Shubman, his second of the tournament, change of pace from Bumrah, slower ball outside off, dabbed down towards third man for a single
Bumrah to A Russell, 1 run, 146.1kph, another in-angling yorker, Russell moves leg-side and knocks it to long-on. Eighth IPL fifty for Dre Russ! Raises his bat and points it towards his team's dugout
Barinder to Chris Lynn, 1 run, the slower loopy full-toss from Sran, would have been called as a wide had he let it go, went chasing and chips it wide of cover-point, raises a 27-ball half-century

Chawla to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, dropped! Miscommunication between Karthik and Uthappa and they've put down a sitter. Uthappa had called for it but DK tries to go for the catch and the former ends up spilling it. Pandya had horribly miscued this slog as the top-edge ballooned into the off side
Narine to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 50-run stand up between Hardik and Krunal! Slaps the shortish delivery to mid-off for a single, does Hardik

Shami to Manish Pandey, 1 run, oh boy! He almost had it till the last second there is Ashwin, would've been a stunner had he held onto it, but unfortunately, he couldn't and Pandey gets a lifeline. Fullish and on off, Pandey lifts it hard and ends up hitting it towards KXIP skipper at mid-off, who leapt high and plucked it with his right-hand. He was air-borne when he took it but just when his heels touched the ground, the ball popped out of his hands. Very unlucky

Navdeep Saini to Livingstone, 1 run, 152.8kph, full toss, Livingstone clobbers it through the off-side - off the top part again. Klaasen dived full length to his right at cover-point, but the ball doesn't stick. It'd be harsh to call that a drop. Saved three runs for his team there did the South African
Rutherford to Raina, 1 run, short of length and Raina hops to tuck it backward of square. The 50-run stand comes up

Narine to Sam Curran, 1 run, in the air and dropped. Mohali and drop catches, the saga continues! Sam Curran wanted to repeat his effort of the second ball, he miscues this one. And it goes a long way up in the air. Rinku at long-on comes forward, he fails to get his hands in good position and it pops out
Narine to Pooran, 1 run, brings up the 50-run stand with a clip off his pads to deep square

Mishra to Gowtham, 1 run, oh dear! Would you believe it! Trent Boult has denied Amit Mishra his fourth hat-trick in the IPL. And he would be absolutely gutted. It was a well flighted wrong 'un, Gowtham bends down low and goes for an almighty heave. It comes off the top half of the bat and was in the air for a long time. Two men called for it, one was Boult and the other was Rutherford. Perhaps that put the former off, he misjudged it completely and then had to jump back to complete the catch - can't grab hold of the ball and Mishra has his hands on his head

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, 1 run, dropped again! This one was much easier. Yusuf Pathan, the culprit. He got to be doing better there. It was a slower one on the stumps, Hetmyer was early into the shot and it comes off the outside edge. It came too slowly to Pathan at point and he spills it
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, 1 run, pushes it to sweeper cover for a single
Nabi to Gurkeerat Singh, 1 run, slower and turning in, Mann knocks it through mid-wicket

U Yadav to Saha, 1 run, chance and Chahal has dropped - RCB have been far too clumsy with their catching this season - short and at the stumps, Saha swivelled across and pulled it over square leg - was in the air and Chahal did all the right things, ran across and then slid, got both hands but couldn't hold on
Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, half-tracker to begin with, keeps really low and du Plessis accounts for it by getting his body weight down and dragging the pull to deep mid-wicket

Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, nurdled away through square leg and that brings up du Plessis' fifty. He's found form of late and this is a massive boost for CSK. Raise of the bat to soak in all the applauses from the dug-out
Bumrah to Nitish Rana, 1 run, direct hit and Rana was gone. Full delivery outside off, Rana cue-ends the drive to extra cover and takes on Rohit's throw, he's lucky that it was not on target

Bumrah to Shubman Gill, 1 run, good length, in the channel just outside off. Gill drops it with soft hands in front of extra cover and charges across to the other end. Rohit rushed in and under-armed a throw, but couldn't nail the target
Warrier to Rohit, 1 run, 140.7kph, middle-lined, quiet wristy knock down to long-on
Gurney to Rohit, 1 run, just a punch, lining up well as he carves it through the covers. Also, a fifty -- and Rohit points his bat to his daughter holding it up against his shoulder

Bumrah to Rayudu, 1 run, a direct hit from Rohit and Vijay would have been running all the way to the dug-out - a suicidal call from Rayudu, came down the track and pushed it straight to cover, bounced nicely into Rohit's hands and he had time to to take aim and hit the stumps
Rashid Khan to Dhawan, 1 run, gets low and brings up the 50-run stand with a sweep to the right of short fine
Hooda to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, fifty for Shaw. He points at his badge to the dugout. Delhi need him to kick on and convert it into a big one. Waits for the ball to turn and nudges it past mid-wicket

K Paul to Manish Pandey, 1 run, stunning bit of work from Shaw at cover - a direct hit might have had Manish in trouble. On a length and just outside off, Manish backed away and drove it to the left of cover, Shaw tumbled, stopped the ball, turned around and had a shy at the bowler's end - all in one motion

Boult to du Plessis, 1 run, huge mix-up and this has to be in list of all-time best moments of IPL. So, before I could miss important details, here's what happened. This was dabbed to point and Watto nearly ran in towards Faf who was struck midway having taken a couple of strides forward. Axar Patel then threw the ball to the bowling end where Munro collects and instead of throwing down stumps at his end he chose to fire a wayward throw at the batting end, Pant dives and misses and in the end they sneak in a run. For good part of this chaos, both batsmen were struck in the middle of the pitch and DC had way too many options which eventually led to a disaster
Axar to du Plessis, 1 run, punched down to long-on and a big cheer from the crowd as Faf raises the bat for his fifty

Bumrah to Watson, 1 run, oh Watto, you four-lifed cat. Bumrah lines him up perfectly with a sharp nippy bouncer, Watson pulls, gets hurried up big time, gets a top-edge and Rahul Chahar - running in from deep backward square leg wouldn't have had it easier. But alas, it's the finals, he slides, lets it pop out
Krunal Pandya to Watson, 1 run, squeezed away to the right of point, Ishan does superbly out there, diving, keeping it to onlly a single

SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, have you dropped the game Mr. Raina? That was a short ball, Hardik Pandya mistimes the slap and Raina at cover drops a dolly. Big final and Hardik Pandya gets a chance!!! MI have a huge reprieve
Pattinson to du Plessis, 1 run, back of a length, on off. Swatted off the front foot, to a sliding long-on who's Pandya, Hardik Pandya
Bumrah to Rayudu, 1 run, 142.8kph, yorker, off-lined. Jammed down the ground, coincidentally bringing up the 100-run stand as well

Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, 1 run, dropped -- a massively tough one, but nevertheless, it's put down. Rayudu reverse-sweeps, and Krunal Pandya - backward point - dives to his right, gets both palms, and can't hold on
Bumrah to du Plessis, 1 run, a sort of a miscued punch, wide of extra cover, but nothing's miscued in this fifty

Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, 1 run, was that a dropped catch? Rayudu was down the track to play an uppish flick as Chahar failed to grab it although he put in a dive. It escaped him as he couldn't quite reach there
Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, 1 run, 50-run stand up as Rayudu eases it down to long-off for a gentle single
Gowtham to Pant, 1 run, short, skidding on outside off. Pant crashes it through cover
Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, 1 run, slants it away outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover and 50-run stand between these two
Cottrell to Stoinis, 1 run, pacy fuller length delivery at 136.2kph, Stoinis meets it with a crisp drive to sweeper cover and brings up Delhi's 100

Shami to Hetmyer, 1 run, chance and Gowtham can't hold on - a lively start in Dubai, banged in short and angling across the left-hander, Hetmyer was in no position on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that goes high and over square leg. Gowtham circled around it, he wasn't balanced as he positioned himself, did get both hands and can't hold on

Jordan to Stoinis, no ball, out Stoinis Run Out!! 1 run completed. Short of a length delivery outside off, Stoinis carved it towards sweeper cover, there was never a second run but considering it was the final ball, he just put his head down and raced back for the second. Clean pick and throw from Pooran to the keeper, Stoinis is run-out by a countrymile. Okay, so, it's a no-ball. One more ball left, officially. Stoinis run out (Pooran/Rahul) 53(21) [4s-7 6s-3]
Rashid Khan to de Villiers, 1 run, another flick, no fuss, no risk, mid-wicket

Steyn to Bairstow, 1 run, dropped! It's Padikkal and it's a real toughie. A flat pull from Jonny Bairstow and Dev dives full length to his left after sprinting forward but couldn't quite get the control over the catch
Shivam Dube to T Natarajan, 1 run, pushes the full ball to Padikkal at cover and sets off for a quick single. Dev attempts a direct hit at the bowling end and misses, had that hit Natarajan was gone
Shreyas Gopal to du Plessis, 1 run, flatter one topspinning into Faf's gut, as he crouches and pulls it away to backward square leg for one

Unadkat to Vijay, 1 run, a direct hit and Vijay was gone. The idea of a quick single, after tapping this slower ball in front of cover, is well and good. But Vijay is no spring chicken. Would've been a few inches short as the fielder swooped and spun around for the throw
Chawla to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, slower and wider of off, eased square on the off-side for a single

Chawla to Samson, 1 run, fifty off 19 balls. Samson has turned it around for the Royals. Just a bat raise and is congratulated by his skipper. Quicker delivery outside off, Samson cracks it to sweeper cover
Jadeja to Smith, 1 run, flatter and around off, Smith moves back and across to work it towards mid-wicket
Boult to Russell, 1 run, closer towards off, with Russell clearing out his front leg to and slogging away straight to long-on

Bumrah to Narine, 1 run, rattles Narine with a short delivery and cramps him up for pace as he backs away to the leg-side. Pulls and it deflects onto his helmet before falling to the floor. His skipper calls him for a quick single and it would've been a disaster if Bumrah had hit the stumps there
Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, spinning in but down leg, Rohit sweeps and misses, the ball deflects off his pad and nutmegs Karthik, the pair manage to cross over

Cummins to Rohit, 1 run, in the air and lands safely. Slower ball banged into the surface, Rohit goes for his favorite pull but was a bit early into the shot, the ball hits him high on the bat and balloons towards square leg, no one there to take the catch

Cummins to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, tight single. Pandya moves across to flick it into the on-side, the leading edge flies towards backward point and Rohit calls for the quick single, he would have been short with a direct hit

Washington Sundar to Rahul, 1 run, fifty for Rahul. Applause from his team mates in the dugout. It is his 17th IPL fifty and first as skipper. Pooran walks up to congratulate his skipper. Flatter delivery on the stumps, Rahul works it to deep mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rahul punches it to long-on

Shivam Dube to Maxwell, 1 run, now Maxwell almost chips one to mid-off. Ful delivery on off-stump, Maxwell is half hearted in his attempted loft, chips it towards mid-off, Negi is quick to race across the turf and dive to his right, just out of his reach

Steyn to Rahul, 1 run, dropped! Kohli has put one down in the deep. Low full toss and Rahul crouches low to whip it over the rope, he doesn't get enough to clear the long boundary in Dubai, Kohli moves to his right and might have just overran a bit. He tries to adjust and take it over his head, but the ball just doesn't stick. How costly will it be?

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, 1 run, oh no! Dropped again. Kohli again. Another slower ball on a fullish length, Rahul tries his best to manufacture power, but doesn't manage to and skies it towards long-off, Kohli runs in and this was a much easier chance than the previous one. He wriggles his hand as to gesturing that the ball might have been wet due to dew

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, 1 run, another slower one on a length, worked away for a single (well, inside edge to be honest) to bring up the fifty-run stand in the powerplay. That's one box check. Platform laid for a good score.
Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, 1 run, goes a little wide of the crease to deliver that googly. Finch nudged that out to deep mid-wicket for a single
Mishra to du Plessis, 1 run, use of the feet to drive this firmly down the ground to long-on

Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, he's not hit this well. He grunts "Aaaargh" as soon as he hit that in the air and Hetymer has put down a sitter. What has he done? This was the short delivery outside off stump, du Plessis just chipped it high over cover-point, Hetty ran in and probably overran, came around chest height and he couldn't control. This is a massive let off!
Rabada to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, tucks this short of length delivery to backward square leg. Fifty stand between these two
Hazlewood to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, 50-run stand up between this pair as Shreyas Iyer squeezes the yorker to square third man. They need to hit a few big ones here..
Jadeja to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, 96kph, straighter one on middle, with Shaw shuffling and tucking into mid-wicket. Also, a fifty

T Natarajan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, full toss and almost a return catch! That was played with a twisted face of the bat and just away from the clutches of the bowler, who made an attempt to grab it to his right
Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fifty of the partnership comes up! That angled in and has been pushed down to long-on for a single. KKR in control
Chakravarthy to Manish Pandey, 1 run, 92kph, very full and around off, Pandey clears his front leg for a hoick-across-the-line and inside-edges it to mid-wicket
Cummins to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fifty for Manish Pandey! An off-pace ball, Pandey reaches the landmark with a cut to deep point. Just a raise of the bat from SRH's No. 3

Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, slight hesitation but they get the single as extra cover can't get across. Williamson drove this gently and wanted one from the outset but Bairstow was a bit unsure. It eventually goes down to long-off

Stoinis to Warner, 1 run, a direct hit and even Warner's dive wouldn't have saved him - drilled the drive straight to extra-cover and set-off for a quick single - Shreyas Iyer was helped by some good bounce and has a shy at the bowler's end

Stoinis to Bairstow, leg byes, 1 run, appeal for LBW - Stoinis liked it and Shreyas points towards the review. Only the height is a matter of concern, looked pretty adjacent to the stumps. It's a fair delivery and there's no bat on that, UltraEdge confirms it. It's umpire's call on hitting the stumps, Bairstow survives. Short of a length and the ball skidded through after pitching, Bairstow was early into the pull and is beaten, struck high on the thigh-pad and the ball is only clipping the bails of middle

Nortje to Bairstow, 1 run, chance and Shreyas can't hold on - would have been a good catch had he held, the ball was always dying onto him, just got his fingertips, but the ball popped out. Bairstow is done in by the slowness of the pitch and is early into the shovel, lobbed off the inner half and towards mid-on
Rajpoot to K Nagarkoti, 1 run, full and close to yorker length, Nagarkoti jams it out to long-on

Unadkat to Narine, 1 run, dropped! The ex KKR player has done them a favour. Narine could have been dismissed for a duck, but he has been given a life by Uthappa. Got deceived due to the slower one and ended up chipping it towards mid-on where the fielder puts down a dolly as he tries to reverse cup it
Rajpoot to K Nagarkoti, 1 run, full and close to yorker length, Nagarkoti jams it out to long-on

Unadkat to Narine, 1 run, dropped! The ex KKR player has done them a favour. Narine could have been dismissed for a duck, but he has been given a life by Uthappa. Got deceived due to the slower one and ended up chipping it towards mid-on where the fielder puts down a dolly as he tries to reverse cup it
Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit, 1 run, 50-run stand up as Rohit nudges the shortish delivery through mid-wicket for one. Need to up the ante now that both the batsmen have got their eye in

Neesham to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, dropped by Bishnoi at deep mid-wicket. Ishan Kishan had completely mistimed the pull shot, but the fielder running in couldn't latch onto the catch. Was a good effort to get there with a sprint, just that the end result wasn't in the fielder's favour. Was a short ball that induced a top-edge
Shami to Rohit, 1 run, bodyline, swatted round the corner

Chahar to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, another chance and Shardul has put down a sitter - butter fingers all of a sudden from CSK, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Abhishek was looking to go inside out over cover - the bat-face turned on impact and he carved it over point - Shardul had plenty of time on the ball and somehow makes a mess of it
Dwayne Bravo to Priyam Garg, 1 run, Maiden IPL fifty for Garg, first of many to come? Low full-toss on the pads and it's clipped past square leg for a single
Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, 1 run, you can't keep him silent for long! Beware, other IPL teams! Fifty for Virat Kohli and he reaches there by dinking a full ball down to long-on

Tom Curran to Devdutt Padikkal, 1 run, a proper miscue.. who wants it? Actually nobody as it falls safely at long-on. Was through the shot early, skews it up after losing his balance.. Padikkal gets away. Lady luck shining brightly on him so far
Udana to Lomror, 1 run, full toss outside off and it has been driven through covers by Lomror for one
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, 1 run, fuller and on the pads, Uthappa flicks it away towards deep square leg
Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, patted in front of backward point and the pair cross over. The 50-partnership comes up between these two
Narine to Dhawan, 1 run, fires this short outside off, it spins back in slightly and Dhawan mistimes the cut wide of cover

Russell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Shaw may have been struggling here. Have to confirm with the replay. But Morgan's under-arm flick running in from cover misses the mark. Would've been touch and go. It was Shaw's call anyway, so he had no one else to blame. Iyer was less sure after tapping this back of a length delivery into the off-side

Russell to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, Shaw had given up at the non-striker's end. Cummins, from mid-off, misses the stumps but he has hit Shaw right on the boot. He looks in some pain, but is back up quickly

Nortje to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 149.6kph! Very full ball, Gill jams it out towards mid-off and sets off for a tight single. Iyer misses the target at the bowler's end. A direct hit would have been curtains for Gill
Stoinis to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slow, just outside off, and angling away. A quiet, neat run down to third man -- and fifty
Rabada to R Tripathi, 1 run, 140kph, sharper bouncer, following the backing away for another adjusted hook to fine leg
Nortje to R Tripathi, 1 run, back of a length, sensibly. Tripathi slaps, and finds sweeper
Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, 1 run, full on leg, flicked away to long leg

Bumrah to Warner, 1 run, 146.2kph, Bumrah tries to bowl a yorker and ends up bowling a low full toss. Warner push-drives down the pitch and the mid-off fielder dives to his left to stop it. The single also brings up Warner's fifty! Can he take his team over the winning line. Just 6 runs came off the over - SRH were happy to take the singles against Bumrah

Pollard to Priyam Garg, 1 run, just 7 runs off the over. Overpitched delivery at 121.5kph, Garg gets under it and absolutely smashes it. Pollard is brave to stick his right hand out - over his head - and parry it towards the mid-wicket region. Too harsh to call it a drop...
Jordan to du Plessis, 1 run, Faf follows Watson in raising his fifty. Opens the face as he pushes a full ball to third man. Continues his good form in this tournament
Harpreet Brar to Watson, 1 run, hammered to long-on. 150 stand up. It's as if their earlier troubles didn't even exist
Shami to du Plessis, 1 run, right in the blockhole, Faf squeezes it wide of square leg. A 100-run opening stand for CSK. What bliss for their teammates who stand up to applaud
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, 1 run, opens the bat face and glides it down to third man for one
Dwayne Bravo to Agarwal, 1 run, 50-run stand up between the openers as Agarwal glides the short of a length delivery down to third man
Chahal to Pant, 1 run, once more keeps it on middle and leg, Pant nudges it square on the leg-side

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, 1 run, dropped! How costly a miss is this going to be? They dropped Rahul around the same time and we know what happened after. This was a full toss and Stoinis does not get it off the middle, heaves it towards deep mid-wicket where Chahal moves to his left and lets it slip through his hands. Moeen too was running across from long-on. Did that put him off?
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, back of a length around off, Pant miscues the heave and the ball bounces just in front of long-on. The 50-run stand comes up between the duo and it has come in quick time

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, 1 run, run out chance missed. RCB making the same mistakes they made in their loss against KXIP. Low full toss outside off, Stoinis moves across and flicks it to the right of deep mid-wicket, he wanted the second and was halfway down, even given up since Pant didn't want it. But Kohli does not gather Padikkal's throw and that allows Stoinis to make his ground back
Axar to Kohli, 1 run, darts this one outside off and Kohli punches it through covers for a single

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, dropped! How costly will that be? Curran has no one else to blame than himself. The slower short ball outside off, Hardik tries to flat-bat it down town but the top-edge flies straight up to the right of the bowler, Curran sets himself up and lets it slip through his hands. He took his eyes off just at the right time
Kartik Tyagi to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, dabbed down towards third man and Suryakumar is off the mark with a single
Rahul Chahar to Tom Curran, 1 run, sliding in on middle and leg, works it through midwicket

Sam Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, a direct hit from Sam Curran would have sent Tripathi back to the pavilion, wasn't to be. Tripathi gave up mid-way after knocking this into the leg-side and Curran did well to gather the ball quickly, missed the target by some distance though
Chahar to R Tripathi, 1 run, hops, dabs in front of backward point (Jadeja again), and this time Tripathi would've comfortably been out had it been a direct hit at the non-striker's. Alas ..

Sam Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, a direct hit from Sam Curran would have sent Tripathi back to the pavilion, wasn't to be. Tripathi gave up mid-way after knocking this into the leg-side and Curran did well to gather the ball quickly, missed the target by some distance though
Chahar to R Tripathi, 1 run, hops, dabs in front of backward point (Jadeja again), and this time Tripathi would've comfortably been out had it been a direct hit at the non-striker's. Alas ..

T Natarajan to Maxwell, 1 run, put down! 121.1kph, length ball, driven back at the bowler and it comes at knee-high to the left of the bowler. Natarajan was a bit late to react and ended up parrying it to mid-on
T Natarajan to Maxwell, 1 run, 134.2kph, Natarajan gets away with a full toss as Maxwell miscues the aerial flick. Falls in vacant deep-ish square leg region

Arshdeep Singh to Bairstow, 1 run, another full toss that Bairstow can't take full toll of, slams it straight down the ground but long-on gets across swiftly to keep the batsmen to just a single. 100-run stand is up!! These two just enjoy batting together, don't they?

Mujeeb to Warner, 1 run, fifty for Warner. Second of the season. He started aggressively today but has taken a step back once Bairstow went berserk. Looks like he will bat through the innings. Just a raise of the bat to celebrate the milestone. Mujeeb follows Warner and is tucked away through mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to Axar, 1 run, full toss outside off, Axar slices it towards the fielder at point

Jofra Archer to Axar, 1 run, has Archer damaged his finger there? This was a rocket throw by Smith from mid-off and the bowler seems to be in some pain. But it's his left hand, so no problem. Was a full ball that was drilled by Axar and he has managed to get a quick single
Tye to Pant, 1 run, juicy full toss outside off at 136ks, Pant looks to go hard but ends up slicing the drive off the outer half towards deep point
Rabada to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, tummy-lined, around off, dabbed down to third man
Ashwin to Jaiswal, 1 run, pushes this one hastily off the backfoot to mid-on for a quick single as Ashwin himself has to chase after it to prevent the single - but he doesn't manage to
